YAHOO.widget.Slider.name: YAHOO.widget.Slider

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the element linked to this instance

params.name: sGroup
params.description: The group of related DragDrop items

params.name: oThumb
params.description: The thumb for this slider

params.name: sType
params.description: The type of slider (horiz, vert, region)

constructors.description:
A DragDrop implementation that can be used as a background for a
slider.  It takes a reference to the thumb instance 
so it can delegate some of the events to it.  The goal is to make the 
thumb jump to the location on the background when the background is 
clicked.

slideEnd.description: Event that fires at the end of a slider thumb move

params.name: newOffset|x
params.description:
the new offset for normal sliders, or the new
x offset for region sliders

params.name: y
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb has moved on the y axis
(region sliders only)

change.description:
Event the fires when the value of the control changes.  If 
the control is animated the event will fire every point
along the way.

slideStart.description: Event that fires at the beginning of a slider thumb move.

params.name: thumbEvent
params.description:
set to true if this event is fired from an event
that occurred on the thumb.  If it is, the state of the
thumb dd object should be correct.  Otherwise, the event
originated on the background, so the thumb state needs to
be refreshed before proceeding.

fireEvents.description:
Fires the change event if the value has been changed.  Ignored if we are in
the middle of an animation as the event will fire when the animation is
complete

return.description: a horizontal slider control

YAHOO.widget.Slider.getHorizSlider.description: Factory method for creating a horizontal slider

params.name: sBGElId
params.description: the id of the slider's background element

params.name: sHandleElId
params.description: the id of the thumb element

params.name: iLeft
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move left

params.name: iRight
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move right

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
optional parameter for specifying that the element 
should move a certain number pixels at a time.

focus.description:
Try to focus the element when clicked so we can add
accessibility features

onMouseDown.description: Handles the mousedown event for the slider background

params.name: e
params.description: the keydown event

handleKeyDown.description:
Executed when a keydown event happens with the control focused.
Updates the slider value and display when the keypress is an
arrow key, home, or end as long as enableKeys is set to true.

return.description: the current horizontal offset

getXValue.description: Returns the slider's thumb X offset from the start position

params.name: x
params.description: the X coordinate of the click

params.name: y
params.description: the Y coordinate of the click

params.name: skipAnim
params.description: don't animate if the move happend onDrag

moveThumb.description:
Move the associated slider moved to a timeout to try to get around the 
mousedown stealing moz does when I move the slider element between the 
cursor and the background during the mouseup event

return.description: true if the move was performed, false if it failed

params.name: newOffset
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb should be
positioned away from the initial start point (x axis for region)

params.name: newOffset2
params.description:
the number of pixels the thumb should be
positioned away from the initial start point (y axis for region)

params.name: skipAnim
params.description:
set to true to disable the animation
for this move action (but not others).

params.name: force
params.description: ignore the locked setting and set value anyway

setRegionValue.description: Provides a way to set the value of the region slider in code.

onSliderEnd.description: Event that fires at the end of a slider thumb move

thumbMouseUp.description: Handles mouseup event on the slider background

return.description: a slider region control

the number of pixels the thumb has moved

When the thumb is available, we cache the centerpoint of the element so
we can position the element correctly when the background is clicked

handleThumbChange.description: Internal handler for the slider thumb's onChange event

endMove.description: Fired when the slider movement ends

YAHOO.widget.Slider.getVertSlider.description: Factory method for creating a vertical slider

params.name: sBGElId
params.description: the id of the slider's background element

params.name: sHandleElId
params.description: the id of the thumb element

params.name: iUp
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move up

params.name: iDown
params.description: the number of pixels the element can move down

params.name: iTickSize
params.description:
optional parameter for specifying that the element 
should move a certain number pixels at a time.

params.name: e
params.description: the keypress event

handleKeyPress.description:
Executed when a keypress event happens with the control focused.
Prevents the default behavior for navigation keys.  The actual
logic for moving the slider thumb in response to a key event
happens in handleKeyDown.

setStartSliderState.description: Initialization that sets up the value offsets once the elements are ready

return.description: the current value

getValue.description: Returns the slider's thumb offset from the start position

b4MouseDown.description: Resets the constraints before moving the thumb.

_getNextY.description: Returns the next Y tick value based on the current coord and the target coord.

_getNextX.description: Returns the next X tick value based on the current coord and the target coord.

moveComplete.description:
moveComplete is set to true when the slider has moved to its final
destination.  For animated slider, this value can be checked in 
the onChange handler to make it possible to execute logic only
when the move is complete rather than at all points along the way.
Deprecated because this flag is only useful when the background is
clicked and the slider is animated.  If the user drags the thumb,
the flag is updated when the drag is over ... the final onDrag event
fires before the mouseup the ends the drag, so the implementer will
never see it.

isTarget.description: Overrides the isTarget property in YAHOO.util.DragDrop

thumb.description:
A YAHOO.widget.SliderThumb instance that we will use to 
reposition the thumb when the background is clicked

baselinePos.description:
The basline position of the background element, used
to determine if the background has moved since the last
operation.

thumbCenterPoint.description:
The center of the slider element is stored so we can 
place it in the correct position when the background is clicked.

keyIncrement.description:
Specifies the number of pixels the arrow keys will move the slider.
Default is 25.

backgroundEnabled.description: Set to false to disable a background click thumb move

animationDuration.description:
If animation is configured, specifies the length of the animation
in seconds.

YAHOO.widget.Slider.ANIM_AVAIL.description: By default, animation is available if the animation library is detected.

type.description: The type of the slider (horiz, vert, region)

animate.description: Flag that determines if the thumb will animate when moved

tickPause.description:
Adjustment factor for tick animation, the more ticks, the
faster the animation (by default)

enableKeys.description: Enables the arrow, home and end keys, defaults to true.

YAHOO.widget.Slider.description:
A DragDrop implementation that can be used as a background for a
slider.  It takes a reference to the thumb instance 
so it can delegate some of the events to it.  The goal is to make the 
thumb jump to the location on the background when the background is 
clicked.

YAHOO.util.AnimMgr.name: YAHOO.util.AnimMgr

run.description: Called per Interval to handle each animation frame.

params.name: tween
params.description: The Anim instance to be be registered

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the Anim instance

unRegister.description:
removes an animation instance from the animation queue.
All animation instances must be registered in order to animate.

params.name: tween
params.description:
A specific Anim instance to stop (optional)
If no instance given, Manager stops thread and all animations.

stop.description: Stops the animation thread or a specific animation instance.

start.description:
Starts the animation thread.
Only one thread can run at a time.

params.name: tween
params.description: The Anim instance to be be registered

registerElement.description:
Adds an animation instance to the animation queue.
All animation instances must be registered in order to animate.

params.name: tween
params.description: The Anim instance being corrected.

correctFrame.description: On the fly frame correction to keep animation on time.

queue.description: The current queue of registered animation objects.

delay.description: Interval delay in milliseconds, defaults to fastest possible.

fps.description:
Base frame rate (frames per second). 
Arbitrarily high for better x-browser calibration (slower browsers drop more frames).

YAHOO.util.AnimMgr.description:
Handles animation queueing and threading.
Used by Anim and subclasses.

YAHOO.util.EventProvider.name: YAHOO.util.EventProvider

params.name: p_type
params.description: The type, or name of the event

unsubscribeAll.description: Removes all listeners from the specified event

params.name: p_type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

params.name: p_fn
params.description: the function to exectute when the event fires

params.name: p_obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event 
fires

params.name: p_override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes the 
execution scope of the listener

subscribe.description: Subscribe to a CustomEvent by event type

return.description: true if the subscriber was found and detached.

params.name: p_type
params.description: The type, or name of the event

params.name: p_fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to unsubscribe, if not
supplied, all subscribers will be removed.

params.name: p_obj
params.description:
The custom object passed to subscribe.  This is
optional, but if supplied will be used to
disambiguate multiple listeners that are the same
(e.g., you subscribe many object using a function
that lives on the prototype)

unsubscribe.description: Unsubscribes one or more listeners the from the specified event

params.name: type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

hasEvent.description:
Returns true if the custom event of the provided type has been created
with createEvent.

return.description:
the return value from CustomEvent.fire, or null if 
the custom event does not exist.

params.name: p_type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

fireEvent.description:
Fire a custom event by name. The callback functions will be executed from the scope specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The first argument fire() was executed with
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method

return.description: the custom event

params.name: p_type
params.description: the type, or name of the event

params.name: p_config
params.description:
optional config params. Valid properties are:
  • scope: defines the default execution scope. If not defined the default scope will be this instance.
  • silent: if true, the custom event will not generate log messages. This is false by default.
  • onSubscribeCallback: specifies a callback to execute when the event has a new subscriber. This will fire immediately for each queued subscriber if any exist prior to the creation of the event.

createEvent.description:
Creates a new custom event of the specified type.  If a custom event
by that name already exists, it will not be re-created.  In either
case the custom event is returned.

__yui_subscribers.description: Private storage of custom event subscribers

YAHOO.util.EventProvider.description:
EventProvider is designed to be used with YAHOO.augment to wrap 
CustomEvents in an interface that allows events to be subscribed to 
and fired by name.  This makes it possible for implementing code to
subscribe to an event that either has not been created yet, or will
not be created at all.

YAHOO.widget.DataSource.name: YAHOO.widget.DataSource

constructors.description:
The DataSource classes manages sending a request and returning response from a live
database. Supported data include local JavaScript arrays and objects and databases
accessible via XHR connections. Supported response formats include JavaScript arrays,
JSON, XML, and flat-file textual data.

params.name: sQuery

params.name: sQuery

cacheQueryEvent.description: Fired when a query is made to the local cache.

queryEvent.description: Fired when a query is made to the live data source.

cacheFlushEvent.description: Fired when the local cache is flushed.

params.name: oSelf
params.description: The DataSource instance.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The requesting object.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: The query string.

params.name: aResults
params.description: Array of result objects.

getResultsEvent.description: Fired when data is retrieved from the live data source.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

getResults.description:
Retrieves query results, first checking the local cache, then making the
query request to the live data source as defined by the function doQuery.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function implemented by oParent to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Abstract method implemented by subclasses to make a query to the live data
source. Must call the callback function with the response returned from the
query. Populates cache (if enabled).

return.description: Unique name of the DataSource instance

toString.description: Public accessor to the unique name of the DataSource instance.

return.description: aResults  Array of results from local cache if found, otherwise null.

_doQueryCache.description:
Queries the local cache for results. If query has been cached, the callback
function is called with the results, and the cached is refreshed so that it
is now the newest element.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

params.name: oResult
params.description: Data result object, including array of results.

_addCacheElem.description:
Adds a result object to the local cache, evicting the oldest element if the 
cache is full. Newer items will have higher indexes, the oldest item will have
index of 0.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple DataSource instances.

maxCacheEntries.description:
Max size of the local cache.  Set to 0 to turn off caching.  Caching is
useful to reduce the number of server connections.  Recommended only for data
sources that return comprehensive results for queries or when stale data is
not an issue.

queryMatchSubset.description:
Enables query subset matching. If caching is on and queryMatchSubset is
true, substrings of queries will return matching cached results. For
instance, if the first query is for "abc" susequent queries that start with
"abc", like "abcd", will be queried against the cache, and not the live data
source. Recommended only for DataSources that return comprehensive results
for queries with very few characters.

_aCache.description: Local cache of data result objects indexed chronologically.

ERROR_DATANULL.description: Error message for null data responses.

queryMatchCase.description:
Enables case-sensitivity in the matching algorithm used against JS Array
types of DataSources and DataSource caches. If queryMatchCase is true, only
case-sensitive matches will return.

queryMatchContains.description:
Use this to fine-tune the matching algorithm used against JS Array types of
DataSource and DataSource caches. If queryMatchContains is true, then the JS
Array or cache returns results that "contain" the query string. By default,
queryMatchContains is set to false, so that only results that "start with"
the query string are returned.

ERROR_DATAPARSE.description: Error message for data responses with parsing errors.

YAHOO.widget.DataSource.description:
The DataSource classes manages sending a request and returning response from a live
database. Supported data include local JavaScript arrays and objects and databases
accessible via XHR connections. Supported response formats include JavaScript arrays,
JSON, XML, and flat-file textual data.

figure out what we can do about mouse events lost when the 
user drags objects beyond the window boundary.  Currently we can 
detect this in internet explorer by verifying that the mouse is 
down during the mousemove event.  Firefox doesn't give us the 
button state on the mousemove event.

This is in the format that is stored in the drag and drop instance, so typical usage is: YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.refreshCache(ddinstance.groups); Alternatively: YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.refreshCache({group1:true, group2:true});

params.name: groups
params.description: an associative array of groups to refresh

refreshCache.todo:
this really should be an indexed array.  Alternatively this
method could accept both.

return.description:
true if this element is a DragDrop handle, false 
otherwise

isHandle.description:
Utility function to determine if a given element has been 
registered as a drag drop handle for the given Drag Drop object.

params.name: id
params.description: the element id to check

handleMouseUp.description:
Internal function to handle the mouseup event.  Will be invoked 
from the context of the document.

params.name: e
params.description: the event

return.description: true if the element looks usable

verifyEl.description:
This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM.  The
main purpose is to handle cases where innerHTML is used to remove
drag and drop objects from the DOM.  IE provides an 'unspecified
error' when trying to access the offsetParent of such an element

params.name: el
params.description: the element to check

params.name: moveEl
params.description: The element to move

params.name: targetEl
params.description: The position reference element

moveToEl.description:
Sets the x/y position of an element to the location of the
target element.

dragThreshMet.description:
Flag that indicates that either the drag pixel threshold or the 
mousdown time threshold has been met

clickPixelThresh.description:
The number of pixels that the mouse needs to move after the 
mousedown before the drag is initiated.  Default=3;

initialized.description:
Internal flag that is set to true when drag and drop has been
intialized

stopPropagation.description:
Flag to determine if we should stop the propagation of the events 
we generate. This is true by default but you may want to set it to
false if the html element contains other features that require the
mouse click.

handleIds.description:
Array of element ids defined as drag handles.  Used to determine 
if the element that generated the mousedown event is actually the 
handle and not the html element itself.

POINT.description:
In point mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the 
location of the cursor during the drag/drop

deltaX.description: the X distance between the cursor and the object being dragged

deltaY.description: the Y distance between the cursor and the object being dragged

dragOvers.description: the DragDrop object(s) that are being hovered over

useCache.description:
Set useCache to false if you want to force object the lookup of each
drag and drop linked element constantly during a drag.

clickTimeThresh.description:
The number of milliseconds after the mousedown event to initiate the
drag if we don't get a mouseup event. Default=1000

startX.description:
The X position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a 
drag threshold is met.

startY.description:
The Y position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a 
drag threshold is met.

clickTimeout.description: Timeout used for the click time threshold

STRICT_INTERSECT.description:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined only by the 
overlap of two or more drag and drop objects.

interactionInfo.description:
Provides additional information about the the current set of
interactions.  Can be accessed from the event handlers. It
contains the following properties:
out:       onDragOut interactions
enter:     onDragEnter interactions
over:      onDragOver interactions
drop:      onDragDrop interactions
point:     The location of the cursor
draggedRegion: The location of dragged element at the time
of the interaction
sourceRegion: The location of the source elemtn at the time
of the interaction
validDrop: boolean

locationCache.description:
Location cache that is set for all drag drop objects when a drag is
initiated, cleared when the drag is finished.

INTERSECT.description:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the 
cursor position or the amount of overlap of two or more drag and 
drop objects.

locked.description: All drag and drop can be disabled.

dragCurrent.description: the DragDrop object that is currently being dragged

preventDefault.description:
Flag to determine if we should prevent the default behavior of the
events we define. By default this is true, but this can be set to 
false if you need the default behavior (not recommended)

ids.description:
Two dimensional Array of registered DragDrop objects.  The first 
dimension is the DragDrop item group, the second the DragDrop 
object.

mode.description: The current drag and drop mode.  Default: POINT

YAHOO.util.DragDropMgr.description:
DragDropMgr is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for 
all DragDrop items in the window.  Generally, you will not call 
this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could 
be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

YAHOO.util.DragDrop.name: YAHOO.util.DragDrop

params.name: id
params.description: of the element that is linked to this instance

params.name: sGroup
params.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

params.name: config
params.description:
an object containing configurable attributes
Valid properties for DragDrop: 
padding, isTarget, maintainOffset, primaryButtonOnly,

constructors.description:
Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver, onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance:
  • linked element: the element that is passed into the constructor. This is the element which defines the boundaries for interaction with other DragDrop objects.
  • handle element(s): The drag operation only occurs if the element that was clicked matches a handle element. By default this is the linked element, but there are times that you will want only a portion of the linked element to initiate the drag operation, and the setHandleElId() method provides a way to define this.
  • drag element: this represents an the element that would be moved along with the cursor during a drag operation. By default, this is the linked element itself as in {@link YAHOO.util.DD}. setDragElId() lets you define a separate element that would be moved, as in {@link YAHOO.util.DDProxy}
This class should not be instantiated until the onload event to ensure that the associated elements are available. The following would define a DragDrop obj that would interact with any other DragDrop obj in the "group1" group: 
dd = new YAHOO.util.DragDrop("div1", "group1");
Since none of the event handlers have been implemented, nothing would actually happen if you were to run the code above. Normally you would override this class or one of the default implementations, but you can also override the methods you want on an instance of the class... 
dd.onDragDrop = function(e, id) {
  alert("dd was dropped on " + id);
}

params.name: sGroup
params.description: the name of the group

addToGroup.description:
Add this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All 
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many 
groups as needed.

Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation

Normally the drag element is moved pixel by pixel, but we can specify

Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be 
used to initiate the drag operation.  An example of this would be if 
you have a content div with text and links.  Clicking anywhere in the 
content area would normally start the drag operation.  Use this method
to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element 
that starts the drag operation.

This is supposed to happen at each level through the inheritance chain.  So
a DDProxy implentation will execute apply config on DDProxy, DD, and

each object.

the drop zone intersection with this object.

this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the

setPadding.description:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.  
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

unreg.description: Remove all drag and drop hooks for this element

params.name: e
params.description: the mousedown event

b4MouseDown.description: Code executed immediately before the onMouseDown event

b4DragOut.description: Code that executes immediately before the onDragOut event

params.name: id
params.description: the element id of the element you wish to ignore

addInvalidHandleId.description:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

setXTicks.description:
Create the array of horizontal tick marks if an interval was specified
in setXConstraint().

hasOuterHandles.description:
By default, drags can only be initiated if the mousedown occurs in the
region the linked element is.  This is done in part to work around a
bug in some browsers that mis-report the mousedown if the previous
mouseup happened outside of the window.  This property is set to true
if outer handles are defined.

yTicks.description:
Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a 
vertical graduation/interval.  This array is generated automatically 
when you define a tick interval.

startPageY.description:
The linked element's absolute X position at the time the drag was 
started

id.description:
The id of the element associated with this object.  This is what we 
refer to as the "linked element" because the size and position of 
this element is used to determine when the drag and drop objects have 
interacted.

deltaX.description: The difference between the click position and the source element's location

deltaY.description: The difference between the click position and the source element's location

invalidHandleIds.description: An associative array of ids for elements that will be ignored if clicked

config.description: Configuration attributes passed into the constructor

dragElId.description:
The id of the element that will be dragged.  By default this is same 
as the linked element , but could be changed to another element. Ex: 
YAHOO.util.DDProxy

available.description: The availabe property is false until the linked dom element is accessible.

invalidHandleClasses.description:
An indexted array of css class names for elements that will be ignored
if clicked.

_domRef.description: Cached reference to the linked element

invalidHandleTypes.description: An associative array of HTML tags that will be ignored if clicked.

startPageX.description:
The linked element's absolute X position at the time the drag was 
started

constrainY.description: Set to true when vertical contraints are applied

constrainX.description: Set to true when horizontal contraints are applied

xTicks.description:
Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a 
horizontal graduation/interval.  This array is generated automatically
when you define a tick interval.

groups.description:
The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are 
related.  Instances only get events when interacting with other 
DragDrop object in the same group.  This lets us define multiple 
groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

locked.description:
Individual drag/drop instances can be locked.  This will prevent 
onmousedown start drag.

handleElId.description:
the id of the element that initiates the drag operation.  By default 
this is the linked element, but could be changed to be a child of this
element.  This lets us do things like only starting the drag when the 
header element within the linked html element is clicked.

maintainOffset.description:
Maintain offsets when we resetconstraints.  Set to true when you want
the position of the element relative to its parent to stay the same
when the page changes

primaryButtonOnly.description:
By default the drag and drop instance will only respond to the primary
button click (left button for a right-handed mouse).  Set to true to
allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated
by the browser

YAHOO.util.DragDrop.description:
Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets. It was designed to be extended, overriding the event handlers for startDrag, onDrag, onDragOver, onDragOut. Up to three html elements can be associated with a DragDrop instance:
  • linked element: the element that is passed into the constructor. This is the element which defines the boundaries for interaction with other DragDrop objects.
  • handle element(s): The drag operation only occurs if the element that was clicked matches a handle element. By default this is the linked element, but there are times that you will want only a portion of the linked element to initiate the drag operation, and the setHandleElId() method provides a way to define this.
  • drag element: this represents an the element that would be moved along with the cursor during a drag operation. By default, this is the linked element itself as in {@link YAHOO.util.DD}. setDragElId() lets you define a separate element that would be moved, as in {@link YAHOO.util.DDProxy}
This class should not be instantiated until the onload event to ensure that the associated elements are available. The following would define a DragDrop obj that would interact with any other DragDrop obj in the "group1" group: 
dd = new YAHOO.util.DragDrop("div1", "group1");
Since none of the event handlers have been implemented, nothing would actually happen if you were to run the code above. Normally you would override this class or one of the default implementations, but you can also override the methods you want on an instance of the class... 
dd.onDragDrop = function(e, id) {
  alert("dd was dropped on " + id);
}

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.name: YAHOO.util.CustomEvent

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of event, which is passed to the callback
when the event fires

params.name: oScope
params.description:
The context the event will fire from.  "this" will
refer to this object in the callback.  Default value: 
the window object.  The listener can override this.

params.name: silent
params.description:
pass true to prevent the event from writing to
the debugsystem

params.name: signature
params.description:
the signature that the custom event subscriber
will receive. YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST or 
YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT.  The default is
YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST.

constructors.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event 
fires

params.name: override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes 
the execution scope of the listener.
if an object, that object becomes the
the execution scope.

subscribeEvent.description:
Custom events provide a custom event that fires whenever there is
a new subscriber to the event.  This provides an opportunity to
handle the case where there is a non-repeating event that has
already fired has a new subscriber.

return.description:
false if one of the subscribers returned false, 
true otherwise

params.name: arguments
params.description:
an arbitrary set of parameters to pass to 
the handler.

fire.description:
Notifies the subscribers. The callback functions will be executed from the scope specified when the event was created, and with the following parameters:
  • The type of event
  • All of the arguments fire() was executed with as an array
  • The custom object (if any) that was passed into the subscribe() method

return.description: The number of listeners unsubscribed

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description:
An object to be passed along when the event 
fires

params.name: override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes 
the execution scope of the listener.
if an object, that object becomes the
the execution scope.

subscribe.description: Subscribes the caller to this event

return.description: True if the subscriber was found and detached.

params.name: fn
params.description:
The subscribed function to remove, if not supplied
all will be removed

params.name: obj
params.description:
The custom object passed to subscribe.  This is
optional, but if supplied will be used to
disambiguate multiple listeners that are the same
(e.g., you subscribe many object using a function
that lives on the prototype)

silent.description:
By default all custom events are logged in the debug build, set silent
to true to disable debug outpu for this event.

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT.description:
Subscriber listener sigature constant.  The FLAT type returns two
parameters: the first argument passed to fire and the optional 
custom object

signature.description:
Custom events support two styles of arguments provided to the event subscribers.
  • YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST:
    • param1: event name
    • param2: array of arguments sent to fire
    • param3: a custom object supplied by the subscriber
  • YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.FLAT
    • param1: the first argument passed to fire. If you need to pass multiple parameters, use and array or object literal
    • param2: a custom object supplied by the subscriber

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.LIST.description:
Subscriber listener sigature constant.  The LIST type returns three
parameters: the event type, the array of args passed to fire, and
the optional custom object

scope.description:
The scope the the event will fire from by default.  Defaults to the window 
obj

type.description: The type of event, returned to subscribers when the event fires

YAHOO.util.CustomEvent.description:
The CustomEvent class lets you define events for your application
that can be subscribed to by one or more independent component.

namespace.description:
Returns the namespace specified and creates it if it doesn't exist 
YAHOO.namespace("property.package");
YAHOO.namespace("YAHOO.property.package");
Either of the above would create YAHOO.property, then YAHOO.property.package Be careful when naming packages. Reserved words may work in some browsers and not others. For instance, the following will fail in Safari:

This fails because "long" is a future reserved word in ECMAScript

YAHOO.description:

existing YAHOO object will not be overwritten so that defined
namespaces are preserved.

onAvailable.description:
Executes the supplied callback when the item with the supplied
id is found.  This is meant to be used to execute behavior as
soon as possible as the page loads.  If you use this after the
initial page load it will poll for a fixed time for the element.
The number of times it will poll and the frequency are
configurable.  By default it will poll for 10 seconds.

Finds the event in the window object, the caller's arguments, or
in the arguments of another method in the callstack.  This is
executed automatically for events registered through the event
manager, so the implementer should not normally need to execute
this function at all.

isSafari.description:
Safari detection is necessary to work around the preventDefault
bug that makes it so you can't cancel a href click from the 
handler.  Since this function has been used outside of this
utility, it was changed to detect all KHTML browser to be more
friendly towards the non-Safari browsers that share the engine.
Internally, the preventDefault bug detection now uses the
webkit property.

WFN.description: Function wrapped for scope correction and cleanup, int constant

legacyEvents.description:
Cache of DOM0 event handlers to work around issues with DOM2 events
in Safari

DOMReady.description: True when the document is initially usable

POLL_RETRYS.description:
The number of times we should look for elements that are not
in the DOM at the time the event is requested after the document
has been loaded.  The default is 200@amp;50 ms, so it will poll
for 10 seconds or until all outstanding handlers are bound
(whichever comes first).

isIE.description:
IE detection needed to properly calculate pageX and pageY.  
capabilities checking didn't seem to work because another 
browser that does not provide the properties have the values 
calculated in a different manner than IE.

unloadListeners.description:
User-defined unload function that will be fired before all events
are detached

OBJ.description:
Object passed in by the user that will be returned as a 
parameter to the callback, int constant

elCache\nDOM element cache.deprecated: Elements are not cached any longer

webkit.description:
If WebKit is detected, we keep track of the version number of
the engine.  The webkit property will contain a string with
the webkit version number if webkit is detected, null
otherwise.
Safari 1.3.2 (312.6): 312.8.1 <-- currently the latest
available on Mac OSX 10.3.
Safari 2.0.2: 416 <-- hasOwnProperty introduced
Safari 2.0.4: 418 <-- preventDefault fixed (I believe)
Safari 2.0.4 (419.3): 418.9.1 <-- current release
http://developer.apple.com/internet/safari/uamatrix.html

loadComplete.description: True after the onload event has fired

ADJ_SCOPE.description:
Adjusted scope, either the element we are registering the event
on or the custom object passed in by the listener, int constant

retryCount.description:
The number of times to poll after window.onload.  This number is
increased if additional late-bound handlers are requested after
the page load.

lastError.description:
addListener/removeListener can throw errors in unexpected scenarios.
These errors are suppressed, the method returns false, and this property
is set

YAHOO.util.Event.description:
The event utility provides functions to add and remove event listeners,
event cleansing.  It also tries to automatically remove listeners it
registers during the unload event.

The initial values are also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point to its initial state.

trigger.description:
The HTML element(s) whose "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" 
for Opera) trigger the display of the context menu.  Can be a string 
representing the id attribute of the HTML element, an object reference 
for the HTML element, or an array of strings or HTML element references.

configuration for the context menu. See configuration class documentation 
for more details.

Creates a list of options or commands which are made visible in response to 
an HTML element's "contextmenu" event ("mousedown" for Opera).

triggerContextMenuEvent.description:
Custom Event wrapper for the "contextmenu" DOM event 
("mousedown" for Opera) fired by the element(s) that trigger the display of 
the context menu.

init.description:
The ContextMenu class's initialization method. This method is 
automatically called by the constructor, and sets up all DOM references for 
pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

toString.description: Returns a string representing the context menu.

Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be 
changed using the context menu's Config object ("cfg").

cancel.description: Cancels the display of the context menu.

destroy.description: Removes the context menu's <div> element (and accompanying child nodes) from the document.

params.name: sScriptURI
params.description:
Absolute or relative URI to script that returns query
results as JSON, XML, or delimited flat-file data.

params.name: aSchema
params.description: Data schema definition of results.

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: (optional) Object literal of config params.

constructors.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using XML HTTP requests that return
query results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oResponse
params.description: The raw response data to parse.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

parseResponse.description:
Parses raw response data into an array of result objects. The result data key
is always stashed in the [0] element of each result object.

params.name: oCallbackFn
params.description: Callback function defined by oParent object to which to return results.

params.name: sQuery
params.description: Query string.

params.name: oParent
params.description: The object instance that has requested data.

doQuery.description:
Queries the live data source defined by scriptURI for results. Results are
passed back to a callback function.

responseType.description:
XHR response data type. Other types that may be defined are YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.TYPE_XML
and YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.TYPE_FLAT.

scriptQueryAppend.description:
String of key/value pairs to append to requests made to scriptURI. Define
this string when you want to send additional query parameters to your script.
When defined, queries will be sent to
<scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput&<scriptQueryAppend>

responseStripAfter.description:
String after which to strip results. If the results from the XHR are sent
back as HTML, the gzip HTML comment appears at the end of the data and should
be ignored.

scriptURI.description:
Absolute or relative URI to script that returns query results. For instance,
queries will be sent to <scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput

connTimeout.description:
Number of milliseconds the XHR connection will wait for a server response. A
a value of zero indicates the XHR connection will wait forever. Any value
greater than zero will use the Connection utility's Auto-Abort feature.

scriptQueryParam.description:
Query string parameter name sent to scriptURI. For instance, queries will be
sent to <scriptURI>?<scriptQueryParam>=userinput

connMgr.description:
Alias to YUI Connection Manager. Allows implementers to specify their own
subclasses of the YUI Connection Manager utility.

YAHOO.widget.DS_XHR.description:
Implementation of YAHOO.widget.DataSource using XML HTTP requests that return
query results.

SHOW_WEEKDAYS.description: True if the Calendar should show weekday labels. True by default.

MDY_DAY_POSITION.description: The position of the day in a month/day/year date string

MY_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/year date string

MONTHS_SHORT.description: The short month labels for the current locale.

MULTI_SELECT.description: True if the Calendar should allow multiple selections. False by default.

DATE_FIELD_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit date fields in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

MY_YEAR_POSITION.description: The position of the year in a month/year date string

close.description: Whether or not a close button should be displayed for this CalendarGroup

MONTHS_LONG.description: The long month labels for the current locale.

WEEKDAYS_MEDIUM.description: The medium weekday labels for the current locale.

LOCALE_WEEKDAYS.description: The setting that determines which length of weekday labels should be used. Possible values are "1char", "short", "medium", and "long".

DATE_RANGE_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit date ranges in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

SHOW_WEEK_HEADER.description: True if the Calendar should show week row headers. False by default.

title.description: The title to display above the CalendarGroup's month header

maxdate.description: The maximum selectable date in the current Calendar (mm/dd/yyyy)

selected.description: The date or range of dates representing the current Calendar selection

pages.description: The number of pages to include in the CalendarGroup. This value can only be set once, in the CalendarGroup's constructor arguments.

NAV_ARROW_RIGHT.description: The image that should be used for the right navigation arrow.
NAV_ARROW_RIGHT.deprecated: You can customize the image by overriding the default CSS class for the right arrow - "calnavright"

HIDE_BLANK_WEEKS.description: True if the Calendar should suppress weeks that are not a part of the current month. False by default.

mindate.description: The minimum selectable date in the current Calendar (mm/dd/yyyy)

START_WEEKDAY.description: The weekday the week begins on. Default is 0 (Sunday).

SHOW_WEEK_FOOTER.description: True if the Calendar should show week row footers. False by default.

MDY_YEAR_POSITION.description: The position of the year in a month/day/year date string

WEEKDAYS_LONG.description: The long weekday labels for the current locale.

MDY_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/day/year date string

pagedate.description: The month/year representing the current visible Calendar date (mm/yyyy)

MD_DAY_POSITION.description: The position of the day in a month/year date string

NAV_ARROW_LEFT.description: The image that should be used for the left navigation arrow.
NAV_ARROW_LEFT.deprecated: You can customize the image by overriding the default CSS class for the left arrow - "calnavleft"

MD_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/day date string

DATE_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit individual dates in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

LOCALE_MONTHS.description: The setting that determines which length of month labels should be used. Possible values are "short" and "long".

iframe.description: Whether or not an iframe shim should be placed under the Calendar to prevent select boxes from bleeding through in Internet Explorer 6 and below.

WEEKDAYS_1CHAR.description: The 1-character weekday labels for the current locale.

WEEKDAYS_SHORT.description: The short weekday labels for the current locale.

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.name: containerId
params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

constructors.description: YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup is a special container class for YAHOO.widget.Calendar. This class facilitates the ability to have multi-page calendar views that share a single dataset and are dependent on each other. The calendar group instance will refer to each of its elements using a 0-based index. For example, to construct the placeholder for a calendar group widget with id "cal1" and containerId of "cal1Container", the markup would be as follows: <div id="cal1Container_0"></div> <div id="cal1Container_1"></div> The tables for the calendars ("cal1_0" and "cal1_1") will be inserted into those containers.

beforeDeselectEvent.description: Fired before a selection is made

beforeRenderEvent.description: Fired before the Calendar is rendered

beforeSelectEvent.description: Fired before a selection is made

renderEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is rendered

changePageEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar page is changed

resetEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is reset

clearEvent.description: Fired when the Calendar is cleared

params.description: of Date field arrays in the format [YYYY, MM, DD].

params.description: of Date field arrays in the format [YYYY, MM, DD].

deselectEvent.description: Fired when a selection is made

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: cellIndex
params.description: The index of the cell to deselect.

deselectCell.description:
Deselects dates in the CalendarGroup based on the cell index provided. This method is used to select cells without having to do a full render. The selected style is applied to the cells directly.
deselectCell will deselect the cell at the specified index on each displayed Calendar page.

params.name: weekday
params.description: The weekday (0-6) to associate with this renderer

Adds a weekday to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the weekday passed to this method.

render.description: Calls the render function of all child calendars within the group.

nextYear.description: Navigates to the next year in the currently selected month in the calendar widget.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

delegateConfig.description: Delegates a configuration property to the CustomEvents associated with the CalendarGroup's children

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args

params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of years to subtract from the current calendar

subtractYears.description:
Subtcats the designated number of years from the current calendar, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

previousMonth.description: Navigates to the previous month page in the calendar widget.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to select in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

select.description:
Selects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once selection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

params.name: fnName
params.description: The name of the function

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments to pass to the function

callChildFunction.description: Calls a function within all child Calendars within this CalendarGroup.

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: date
params.description:
The date string of dates to deselect in the current calendar. Valid formats are
individual date(s) (12/24/2005,12/26/2005) or date range(s) (12/24/2005-1/1/2006).
Multiple comma-delimited dates can also be passed to this method (12/24/2005,12/11/2005-12/13/2005).
This method can also take a JavaScript Date object or an array of Date objects.

deselect.description:
Deselects a date or a collection of dates on the current calendar. This method, by default,
does not call the render method explicitly. Once deselection has completed, render must be 
called for the changes to be reflected visually.

params.description: Whether or not to apply scope correction

nextMonth.description: Navigates to the next month page in the calendar widget.

init.description:
Initializes the calendar group. All subclasses must call this method in order for the
group to be initialized properly.

return.description: A string representation of the CalendarGroup object.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

params.name: date
params.description: The Date object on which to set the month index

params.name: iMonth
params.description: The month index to set

_setMonthOnDate.description:
Sets the month on a Date object, taking into account year rollover if the month is less than 0 or greater than 11.
The Date object passed in is modified. It should be cloned before passing it into this method if the original value needs to be maintained

return.description: Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.

params.name: cellIndex
params.description: The index of the cell to be selected.

selectCell.description:
Selects dates in the CalendarGroup based on the cell index provided. This method is used to select cells without having to do a full render. The selected style is applied to the cells directly. The value of the MULTI_SELECT Configuration attribute will determine the set of dates which get selected.
  • If MULTI_SELECT is false, selectCell will select the cell at the specified index for only the last displayed Calendar page.
  • If MULTI_SELECT is true, selectCell will select the cell at the specified index, on each displayed Calendar page.

renderFooter.description:
Renders a footer for the 2-up calendar container. By default, this method is
unimplemented.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configSelected.description: The default Config handler for the CalendarGroup "selected" property

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to subscribe to this CustomEvent

params.name: obj
params.description: The CustomEvent's scope object

unsub.description: Proxy unsubscriber to unsubscribe from the CalendarGroup's child Calendars' CustomEvents

return.description: An array of currently selected JavaScript Date objects.

getSelectedDates.description: Gets the list of currently selected dates from the calendar.

params.name: sDates
params.description:
A date string to associate with the specified renderer. Valid formats
include date (12/24/2005), month/day (12/24), and range (12/1/2004-1/1/2005)

params.name: fnRender
params.description: The function executed to render cells that match the render rules for this renderer.

addRenderer.description:
Adds a renderer to the render stack. The function reference passed to this method will be executed
when a date cell matches the conditions specified in the date string for this renderer.

reset.description:
Resets the calendar widget to the originally selected month and year, and 
sets the calendar to the initial selection(s).

return.description:
Array of JavaScript Date objects representing all individual dates that are currently selected.
Assuming that this function executes properly, the return value should be an empty array.
However, the empty array is returned for the sake of being able to check the selection status
of the calendar.

deselectAll.description: Deselects all dates on the current calendar.

params.name: month
params.description: The numeric month, from 0 (January) to 11 (December)

setMonth.description:
Sets the calendar group's month explicitly. This month will be set into the first
page of the multi-page calendar, and all other months will be iterated appropriately.

clear.description:
Clears the selected dates in the current calendar widget and sets the calendar
to the current month and year.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of months to add to the current calendar

addMonths.description:
Adds the designated number of months to the current calendar month, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of months to subtract from the current calendar

subtractMonths.description:
Subtracts the designated number of months from the current calendar month, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

return.description: The YAHOO.widget.Calendar instance that is constructed

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the table element that will represent the calendar widget

params.name: containerId
params.description: The id of the container div element that will wrap the calendar table

params.name: config
params.description: The configuration object containing the Calendar's arguments

constructChild.description:
Constructs a child calendar. This method can be overridden if a subclassed version of the default
calendar is to be used.

params.name: year
params.description: The numeric 4-digit year

setYear.description:
Sets the calendar group's year explicitly. This year will be set into the first
page of the multi-page calendar, and all other months will be iterated appropriately.

renderHeader.description: Renders the header for the CalendarGroup.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of years to add to the current calendar

addYears.description:
Adds the designated number of years to the current calendar, and sets the current
calendar page date to the new month.

YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup.description: YAHOO.widget.CalendarGroup is a special container class for YAHOO.widget.Calendar. This class facilitates the ability to have multi-page calendar views that share a single dataset and are dependent on each other. The calendar group instance will refer to each of its elements using a 0-based index. For example, to construct the placeholder for a calendar group widget with id "cal1" and containerId of "cal1Container", the markup would be as follows: <div id="cal1Container_0"></div> <div id="cal1Container_1"></div> The tables for the calendars ("cal1_0" and "cal1_1") will be inserted into those containers.

constructors.description:
The AutoComplete class provides the customizable functionality of a plug-and-play DHTML auto completion widget. Some key features:
  • Navigate with up/down arrow keys and/or mouse to pick a selection
  • The drop down container can "roll down" or "fly out" via configurable animation
  • UI look-and-feel customizable through CSS, including container attributes, borders, position, fonts, etc

_jumpSelection.description:
For values updated by type-ahead, the right arrow key jumps to the end
of the textbox, otherwise the container is closed.

params.description: HTML markup for results container header.

Sets HTML markup for the results container header. This markup will be
inserted within a <div> tag with a class of "yui-ac-hd".

forceSelection.description:
Whether or not to force the user's selection to match one of the query
results. Enabling this feature essentially transforms the input field into a
<select> field. This feature is not recommended with delimiter character(s)
defined.

animHoriz.description:
Whether or not to animate the expansion/collapse of the results container in the
horizontal direction.

useShadow.description: Whether or not the results container should have a shadow.

useIFrame.description:
Whether or not to use an iFrame to layer over Windows form elements in
IE. Set to true only when the results container will be on top of a
<select> field in IE and thus exposed to the IE z-index bug (i.e.,
5.5 < IE < 7).

_iFrameSrc.description:
Src to iFrame used when useIFrame = true. Supports implementations over SSL
as well.

_queryInterval.description:
For users typing via certain IMEs, queries must be triggered by intervals,
since key events yet supported across all browsers for all IMEs.

_aListItems.description:
Array of <li> elements references that contain query results within the
results container.

_nKeyCode.description: Key code of the last key pressed in textbox.

typeAhead.description:
Whether or not the input field should be automatically updated
with the first query result as the user types, auto-selecting the substring
that the user has not typed.

_nDisplayedItems.description: Number of <li> elements currently displayed in results container.

_bOverContainer.description:
Whether or not the mouse is currently over the results
container. This is necessary in order to prevent clicks on container items
from being text input field blur events.

delimChar.description:
Query delimiter. A single character separator for multiple delimited
selections. Multiple delimiter characteres may be defined as an array of
strings. A null value or empty string indicates that query results cannot
be delimited. This feature is not recommended if you need forceSelection to
be true.

alwaysShowContainer.description:
Whether or not the results container should always be displayed.
Enabling this feature displays the container when the widget is instantiated
and prevents the toggling of the container to a collapsed state.

highlightClassName.description: Class name of a highlighted item within results container.

minQueryLength.description:
Number of characters that must be entered before querying for results. A negative value
effectively turns off the widget. A value of 0 allows queries of null or empty string
values.

prehighlightClassName.description: Class name of a pre-highlighted item within results container.

_maxResultsDisplayed.description: Internal count of <li> elements displayed and hidden in results container.

_sSavedQuery.description: Past queries this session (for saving delimited queries).

_bItemSelected.description:
Whether or not an item has been selected since the container was populated
with results. Reset to false by _populateList, and set to true when item is
selected.

dataSource.description:
The DataSource object that encapsulates the data used for auto completion.
This object should be an inherited object from YAHOO.widget.DataSource.

autoHighlight.description:
Whether or not the first item in results container should be automatically highlighted
on expand.

allowBrowserAutocomplete.description:
Whether or not to allow browsers to cache user-typed input in the input
field. Disabling this feature will prevent the widget from setting the
autocomplete="off" on the input field. When autocomplete="off"
and users click the back button after form submission, user-typed input can
be prefilled by the browser from its cache. This caching of user input may
not be desired for sensitive data, such as credit card numbers, in which
case, implementers should consider setting allowBrowserAutocomplete to false.

animVert.description:
Whether or not to animate the expansion/collapse of the results container in the
vertical direction.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple AutoComplete instances.

_bContainerOpen.description: Whether or not the results container is currently open.

animSpeed.description: Speed of container expand/collapse animation, in seconds..

_oCurItem.description: Pointer to the currently highlighted <li> element in the container.

maxResultsDisplayed.description: Maximum number of results to display in results container.

_bFocused.description:
Whether or not the input field is currently in focus. If query results come back
but the user has already moved on, do not proceed with auto complete behavior.

queryDelay.description:
Number of seconds to delay before submitting a query request.  If a query
request is received before a previous one has completed its delay, the
previous request is cancelled and the new request is set to the delay.

YAHOO.widget.AutoComplete.description:
The AutoComplete class provides the customizable functionality of a plug-and-play DHTML auto completion widget. Some key features:
  • Navigate with up/down arrow keys and/or mouse to pick a selection
  • The drop down container can "roll down" or "fly out" via configurable animation
  • UI look-and-feel customizable through CSS, including container attributes, borders, position, fonts, etc

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for scrolling elements to a position defined by the "scroll" member of "attributes". All "scroll" members are arrays with x, y scroll positions.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Scroll(el, { scroll: { to: [0, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.Scroll.description:
Anim subclass for scrolling elements to a position defined by the "scroll" member of "attributes". All "scroll" members are arrays with x, y scroll positions.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Scroll(el, { scroll: { to: [0, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

getWeekNumber.description:
Calculates the week number for the given date. This function assumes that week 1 is the
week in which January 1 appears, regardless of whether the week consists of a full 7 days.
The calendar year can be specified to help find what a the week number would be for a given
date if the date overlaps years. For instance, a week may be considered week 1 of 2005, or
week 53 of 2004. Specifying the optional calendarYear allows one to make this distinction
easily.

subtract.description: Subtracts the specified amount of time from the this instance.

return.description: true if the date occurs before the compared date; false if not.

before.description: Determines whether a given date is before another date on the calendar.

ONE_DAY_MS.description: Constant field representing one day, in milliseconds

YAHOO.widget.DateMath.description:
YAHOO.widget.DateMath is used for simple date manipulation. The class is a static utility
used for adding, subtracting, and comparing dates.

YAHOO.util.Bezier.name: YAHOO.util.Bezier

return.description: An array containing int x and y member data

params.name: points
params.description: An array containing Bezier points

params.name: t
params.description: A number between 0 and 1 which is the basis for determining current position

getPosition.description:
Get the current position of the animated element based on t.
Each point is an array of "x" and "y" values (0 = x, 1 = y)
At least 2 points are required (start and end).
First point is start. Last point is end.
Additional control points are optional.

YAHOO.util.Bezier.description: Used to calculate Bezier splines for any number of control points.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.name: YAHOO.widget.Menu

classname.description: CSS class to be applied to the menu's root <div> element. The specified class(es) are appended in addition to the default class as specified by the menu's CSS_CLASS_NAME constant.

autosubmenudisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made 
visible when the user mouses over the menu's items.

clicktohide.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will automatically be 
hidden if the user clicks outside of it.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner]. By default
a submenu's top left corner is aligned to its parent menu item's top 
right corner.

constraintoviewport.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu will try to remain inside 
the boundaries of the size of viewport.

maxheight.description:
Defines the maximum height (in pixels) for a menu before the
contents of the body are scrolled.

showdelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is made visible when the user mouses over 
the menu's items.

submenuhidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before a submenu is hidden when the user mouses out of a menu item 
heading in the direction of a submenu.  The value must be greater than or 
equal to the value specified for the "showdelay" configuration property.

visible.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the menu is visible. If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "dynamic" (the default), this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "visibility" style property between "visible" (true) or "hidden" (false). If the menu's "position" configuration property is set to "static" this property toggles the menu's <div> element's "display" style property between "block" (true) or "none" (false).

container.description:
HTML element reference or string specifying the id 
attribute of the HTML element that the menu's markup should be 
rendered into.

position.description:
String indicating how a menu should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menus are 
visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menus are hidden by default, reside 
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and 
can overlay other elements on the screen.

hidedelay.description:
Number indicating the time (in milliseconds) that should 
expire before the menu is hidden.

constructors.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

mouseOutEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has left the menu.  Passes back the DOM 
Event object as an argument.

mouseUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse is 
over the menu.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyPressEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key when one of the
menu's items has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemAddedEvent.description: Fires when an item is added to the menu.

mouseOverEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has entered the menu.  Passes back 
the DOM Event object as an argument.

itemRemovedEvent.description: Fires when an item is removed to the menu.

mouseDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user mouses down on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

clickEvent.description:
Fires when the user clicks the on the menu.  Passes back the 
DOM Event object as an argument.

keyDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses a key when one of the menu's items 
has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

from executing.

strings representing the text for each item to be created, object literals 
representing the menu item configuration properties, or MenuItem instances.  
This property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

parent.description:
Object reference to the menu's parent menu or menu item.  
This property can be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

hiding of a submenu.

Number representing the time-out setting used to cancel the 
scrolling of the menu's body element.

"mouseout" event.

lazyLoad.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu's "lazy load" feature is 
enabled.  If set to "true," initialization and rendering of the menu's 
items will be deferred until the first time it is made visible.  This 
property should be set via the constructor using the configuration 
object literal.

_aListElements.description: Array of <ul> elements, each of which is the parent node for each item's <li> element.

_aItemGroups.description:
Multi-dimensional Array representing the menu items as they
are grouped in the menu.

GROUP_TITLE_TAG_NAME.description:
String representing the tagname of the HTML element used to 
title the menu's item groups.

_bHideDelayEventHandlersAssigned.description:
Boolean indicating if the "mouseover" and "mouseout" event 
handlers used for hiding the menu via a call to "window.setTimeout" have 
already been assigned.

YAHOO.widget.Menu.description:
The Menu class creates a container that holds a vertical list representing 
a set of options or commands.  Menu is the base class for all 
menu containers.

YAHOO.widget.Tab.name: YAHOO.widget.Tab

disabled.description: Whether or not the tab is disabled.

dataTimeout.description: Number if milliseconds before aborting and calling failure handler.

contentEl.description: The HTMLElement that contains the tab's content.

cacheData.description: Whether or not content should be reloaded for every view.

dataSrc.description: The tab's data source, used for loading content dynamically.

loadMethod.description: The method to use for the data request.

contentVisible.description: The Whether or not the tab's content is visible.

activationEvent.description: The event that triggers the tab's activation.

active.description:
Whether or not the tab is currently active.
If a dataSrc is set for the tab, the content will be loaded from
the given source.

labelEl.description: The element that contains the tab's label.

dataLoaded.description: Whether or not any data has been loaded from the server.

params.name: element
params.description:
(optional) The html element that 
represents the TabView. An element will be created if none provided.

params.name: properties
params.description: A key map of initial properties

constructors.description: A representation of a Tab's label and content.

contentChange.description:
Fires after the tab content is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type contentChange
<String> prevValue the previous value
<Boolean> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('contentChange', handler);

activeChange.description:
Fires after the active state is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type activeChange
<Boolean> prevValue the previous value
<Boolean> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('activeChange', handler);

beforeContentChange.description:
Fires before the tab content is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeContentChange
<String> prevValue the current value
<String> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeContentChange', handler);

beforeActiveChange.description:
Fires before the active state is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeActiveChange
<Boolean> prevValue the current value
<Boolean> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeActiveChange', handler);

labelChange.description:
Fires after the tab label is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type labelChange
<String> prevValue the previous value
<String> newValue the updated value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('labelChange', handler);

beforeLabelChange.description:
Fires before the tab label is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeLabelChange
<String> prevValue the current value
<String> newValue the new value

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeLabelChange', handler);

This method evaluates the server response, creates and returns the results via
its properties.  Success and failure cases will differ in the response
object's property values.

This method assembles the form label and value pairs and
constructs an encoded string.
asyncRequest() will automatically initialize the
transaction with a HTTP header Content-Type of
application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

params.description: id or name attribute, or form object.

iframe created in createFrame.

params.name: uri
params.description: Fully qualified path of resource.

resetFormState.description:
Resets HTML form properties when an HTML form or HTML form
with file upload transaction is sent.

getConnectionObject.description:
This method is called by asyncRequest to create a
valid connection object for the transaction.  It also passes a
transaction id and increments the transaction id counter.

createExceptionObject.description:
If a transaction cannot be completed due to dropped or closed connections,
there may be not be enough information to build a full response object.
The failure callback will be fired and this specific condition can be identified
by a status property value of 0.
If an abort was successful, the status property will report a value of -1.

params.name: tId
params.description: The Transaction Id

params.name: callbackArg
params.description: The user-defined argument or arguments to be passed to the callback

params.name: isAbort
params.description: Determines if the exception case is caused by a transaction abort

resetDefaultHeaders.description: Resets the default HTTP headers object

return.description: formElements Collection of hidden fields.
