Parses the POST data and creates hidden form elements
for each key-value, and appends them to the HTML form object.

params.name: postData
params.description: The HTTP POST data

releaseObject.description: Dereference the XHR instance and the connection object after the transaction is completed.

return.description: object

Instantiates a XMLHttpRequest object and returns an object with two properties:
the XMLHttpRequest instance and the transaction id.

params.name: transactionId
params.description: Property containing the transaction id for this transaction.

handleTransactionResponse.description:
This method attempts to interpret the server response and
determine whether the transaction was successful, or if an error or
exception was encountered.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object

params.name: callback
params.description: The sser-defined callback object

params.name: isAbort
params.description: Determines if the transaction was aborted.

Creates an iframe to be used for form file uploads.  It is remove from the
document upon completion of the upload transaction.

params.name: optional
params.description: qualified path of iframe resource for SSL in IE.

handleReadyState.description:
This method serves as a timer that polls the XHR object's readyState
property during a transaction, instead of binding a callback to the
onreadystatechange event.  Upon readyState 4, handleTransactionResponse
will process the response, and the timer will be cleared.

params.description: User-defined callback object.

Member to add an ActiveX id to the existing xml_progid array.
In the event(unlikely) a new ActiveX id is introduced, it can be added
without internal code modifications.

params.description: The ActiveX id to be added to initialize the XHR object.

return.description: void

setPollingInterval.description: Member to modify the default polling interval.

params.description: The polling interval in milliseconds.

setHeader.description: Accessor that sets the HTTP headers for each transaction.

params.name: o
params.description: The connection object for the transaction.

_transaction_id.description: A transaction counter that increments the transaction id for each transaction.

_sFormData.description:
Property modified by setForm() to set the HTML form data
for each transaction.

_default_xhr_header.description:
The default header value for the label
"X-Requested-With".  This is sent with each
transaction, by default, to identify the
request as being made by YUI Connection Manager.

_use_default_post_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
Content-Type of 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
will be added to any client HTTP headers sent for POST
transactions.

_isFileUpload.description:
Property modified by setForm() to determine if a file(s)
upload is expected.

_use_default_xhr_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
'X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest'
will be added to each transaction.

_has_default_header.description:
Determines if custom, default headers
are set for each transaction.

_isFormSubmit.description:
Property modified by setForm() to determine if the data
should be submitted as an HTML form.

_poll.description: Collection of polling references to the polling mechanism in handleReadyState.

_hasSubmitListener.description:
Determines whether YAHOO.util.Event is available and returns true or false.
If true, an event listener is bound at the document level to trap click events that
resolve to a target type of "Submit".  This listener will enable setForm() to determine
the clicked "Submit" value in a multi-Submit button, HTML form.

_default_post_header.description:
Determines if a default header of
Content-Type of 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
will be added to client HTTP headers sent for POST
transactions.

_timeOut.description: Queue of timeout values for each transaction callback with a defined timeout value.

_polling_interval.description:
The polling frequency, in milliseconds, for HandleReadyState.
when attempting to determine a transaction's XHR readyState.
The default is 50 milliseconds.

_submitElementValue.description:
Tracks the name-value pair of the "clicked" submit button if multiple submit
buttons are present in an HTML form; and, if YAHOO.util.Event is available.

_formNode.description:
Property modified by setForm() to set a reference to the HTML
form node if the desired action is file upload.

_has_http_headers.description: Determines if HTTP headers are set.

_msxml_progid.description: Array of MSFT ActiveX ids for XMLHttpRequest.

not linked would be available through the next/previous style links. A 0
value displays all page links. A negative value disables all page links.

each OPTION's value and text with the same value, or an array of object
literals of syntax {value:myValue, text:myText} will populate OPTION with
corresponding value and text. A null value or empty array prevents the

number of rows per page. A value less than 1 will display all available

YAHOO.widget.MenuItem.name: YAHOO.widget.MenuItem

submenu.description:
Object specifying the submenu to be appended to the menu item. The value can be one of the following:
  • Object specifying a Menu instance.
  • Object literal specifying the menu to be created. Format: { id: [menu id], itemdata: [array of values for items] }.
  • String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element of the menu.
  • Object specifying the <div> element of the menu.

classname.description: CSS class to be applied to the menu item's root <li> element. The specified class(es) are appended in addition to the default class as specified by the menu item's CSS_CLASS_NAME constant.

checked.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should be rendered 
with a checkmark.

target.description: String specifying the value for the "target" attribute of the menu item's anchor element. Specifying a target will require the user to click directly on the menu item's anchor node in order to cause the browser to navigate to the specified URL. When building a menu from existing HTML the value of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

url.description:
String specifying the URL for the menu item's anchor's 
"href" attribute.  When building a menu from existing HTML the value 
of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

text.description:
String specifying the text label for the menu item.  
When building a menu from existing HTML the value of this property
will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

selected.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should 
be highlighted.

strongemphasis.description:
Boolean indicating if the text of the menu item will be 
rendered with strong emphasis.  When building a menu from existing 
HTML the value of this property will be interpreted from the
menu's markup.

disabled.description:
Boolean indicating if the menu item should be disabled.  
(Disabled menu items are  dimmed and will not respond to user input 
or fire events.)

emphasis.description:
Boolean indicating if the text of the menu item will be 
rendered with emphasis.  When building a menu from existing HTML the 
value of this property will be interpreted from the menu's markup.

helptext.description:
String specifying additional instructional text to 
accompany the text for the nenu item.

onclick.description:
Object literal representing the code to be executed when the button is clicked. Format:
{
fn: Function, // The handler to call when the event fires.
obj: Object, // An object to pass back to the handler.
scope: Object // The object to use for the scope of the handler.
}

constructors.description: Creates an item for a menu.

mouseOutEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has left the menu item.  Passes back 
the DOM Event object as an argument.

mouseUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a mouse button while the mouse 
is over the menu item.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

keyUpEvent.description:
Fires when the user releases a key when the menu item has 
focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

focusEvent.description: Fires when the menu item receives focus.

keyPressEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses an alphanumeric key when the 
menu item has focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

mouseOverEvent.description:
Fires when the mouse has entered the menu item.  Passes 
back the DOM Event object as an argument.

blurEvent.description: Fires when the menu item loses the input focus.

mouseDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user mouses down on the menu item.  Passes 
back the DOM Event object as an argument.

clickEvent.description:
Fires when the user clicks the on the menu item.  Passes 
back the DOM Event object as an argument.

destroyEvent.description: Fires when the menu item's <li> element is removed from its parent <ul> element.

keyDownEvent.description:
Fires when the user presses a key when the menu item has 
focus.  Passes back the DOM Event object as an argument.

hasFocus.description:
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the menu item
has focus.

DISABLED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_TEXT.description: String representing the text for the submenu arrow indicator element (<em>) when the menu item is disabled.

_oCheckedIndicator.description: Object reference to the menu item's checkmark image.

COLLAPSED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_TEXT.description: String representing the text for the <em> element used for the submenu arrow indicator.

YAHOO.widget.MenuItem._DEFAULT_CONFIG.description: Constant representing the MenuItem's configuration properties

id.description: Id of the menu item's root <li> element. This property should be set via the constructor using the configuration object literal. If an id is not specified, then one will be created using the "generateId" method of the Dom utility.

index.description:
Number indicating the ordinal position of the menu item in 
its group.

SUBMENU_TYPE.description:
Object representing the type of menu to instantiate and 
add when parsing the child nodes of the menu item's source HTML element.

_sClassName.description: The current value of the "classname" configuration attribute.

DISABLED_CHECKED_TEXT.description: String representing the text to be used for the checked indicator element (<em>) when the menu item is disabled.

groupIndex.description:
Number indicating the index of the group to which the menu 
item belongs.

_oSubmenu.description: Object reference to the menu item's submenu.

_oText.description: Object reference to the menu item's text node.

CSS_CLASS_NAME.description: String representing the CSS class(es) to be applied to the <li> element of the menu item.

parent.description: Object reference to the menu item's parent menu.

YAHOO.widget.MenuItem._EVENT_TYPES.description: Constant representing the name of the MenuItem's events

srcElement.description: Object reference to the HTML element (either <li>, <optgroup> or <option>) used create the menu item.

EXPANDED_SUBMENU_INDICATOR_TEXT.description: String representing the text for the submenu arrow indicator element (<em>) when the submenu is visible.

value.description: Object reference to the menu item's value.

element.description: Object reference to the menu item's <li> element.

_oAnchor.description: Object reference to the menu item's <a> element.

constructor.description: Object reference to the menu item's constructor function.

submenuIndicator.description: Object reference to the <em> element used to create the submenu indicator for the menu item.

CHECKED_TEXT.description: String representing the text to be used for the checked indicator element (<em>).

_oHelpTextEM.description: Object reference to the menu item's help text <em> element.

YAHOO.widget.Panel.name: YAHOO.widget.Panel

draggable.description: True if the Panel should be draggable.  Default value is "true" if the Drag and Drop utility is included, otherwise it is "false."

close.description: True if the Panel should display a "close" button

keylisteners.description: A KeyListener (or array of KeyListeners) that will be enabled when the Panel is shown, and disabled when the Panel is hidden.

underlay.description: Sets the type of underlay to display for the Panel. Valid values are "shadow", "matte", and "none".

modal.description: True if the Panel should be displayed in a modal fashion, automatically creating a transparent mask over the document that will not be removed until the Panel is dismissed.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Panel OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Panel

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Panel. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Panel is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS window, with a draggable header and an optional close icon at the top right.

showMaskEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the modality mask is shown

dragEvent.description: CustomEvent when the Panel is dragged

hideMaskEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the modality mask is hidden

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configClose.description: The default event handler fired when the "close" property is changed. The method controls the appending or hiding of the close icon at the top right of the Panel.

return.description: Success or failure of the render

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element id to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering OR

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering

render.description: Renders the Panel by inserting the elements that are not already in the main Panel into their correct places. Optionally appends the Panel to the specified node prior to the render's execution. NOTE: For Panels without existing markup, the appendToNode argument is REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is not present in the document, the function will return false, indicating that the render was a failure.

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for Module which are fired automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args

params.name: obj

configModal.description: The default event handler fired when the "modal" property is changed. This handler subscribes or unsubscribes to the show and hide events to handle the display or hide of the modality mask.

params.description: the right extent

params.description: the bottom extent

constructors.description:
A region is a representation of an object on a grid.  It is defined
by the top, right, bottom, left extents, so is rectangular by default.  If 
other shapes are required, this class could be extended to support it.

return.description: the region's area

getArea.description: Returns the area of the region

return.description: The region that the element occupies

getRegion.description: Returns a region that is occupied by the DOM element

params.name: el
params.description: The element

return.description:
True if the region is contained with this region, 
else false

params.name: region
params.description: The region to evaluate

contains.description: Returns true if this region contains the region passed in

return.description: The union region

params.name: region
params.description: The region that to create the union with

union.description:
Returns the region representing the smallest region that can contain both
the passed in region and this region.

return.description: string the region properties

toString.description: toString

return.description: The overlap region, or null if there is no overlap

params.name: region
params.description: The region that intersects

intersect.description: Returns the region where the passed in region overlaps with this one

1.description: The region's top extent as index, for symmetry with set/getXY

0.description: The region's left extent as index, for symmetry with set/getXY

YAHOO.util.Region.description:
A region is a representation of an object on a grid.  It is defined
by the top, right, bottom, left extents, so is rectangular by default.  If 
other shapes are required, this class could be extended to support it.

The onchange event for the handle/thumb is delegated to the YAHOO.widget.Slider
instance it belongs to.

the number of pixels (positive or negative) the
slider has moved from the start position.

Gets the current offset from the element's start position in
pixels.

the number of pixels (positive or negative) the
slider has moved vertically from the start position.

pixels.

params.description: the number of pixels the element can move down

the number of pixels (positive or negative) the
slider has moved horizontally from the start position.

Gets the current X offset from the element's start position in
pixels.

Informs the drag and drop util that the offsets should remain when
resetting the constraints.  This preserves the slider value when
the constraints are reset

parentElId.description:
The id of the thumbs parent HTML element (the slider background 
element).

tickSize.description: The tick size for this slider

_prevVal.description: Cache the last value so we can check for change

startOffset.description:
The (X and Y) difference between the thumb location and its parent 
(the slider background) when the control is instantiated.

_graduated.description: The slider is _graduated if there is a tick interval defined

scroll.description: Turns off the autoscroll feature in drag and drop

YAHOO.widget.Button.name: YAHOO.widget.Button

srcelement.description: Object reference to the HTML element (either <input> or <span>) used to create the button.

checked.description:
Boolean indicating if the button is checked.  Applies only
to buttons of type "radio" and "checkbox."

name.description: String specifying the name for the button.

title.description: String specifying the title for the button.

menu.description:
Object specifying the menu for the button. The value can be one of the following:
  • Object specifying a YAHOO.widget.Menu instance.
  • String specifying the id attribute of the <div> element used to create the menu.
  • String specifying the id attribute of the <select> element used to create the menu.
  • Object specifying the <div> element used to create the menu.
  • Object specifying the <select> element used to create the menu.
  • Array of object literals, each representing a set of YAHOO.widget.MenuItem configuration attributes.
  • Array of strings representing the text labels for each menu item in the menu.

value.description: Object specifying the value for the button.

label.description: String specifying the button's text label or innerHTML.

disabled.description:
Boolean indicating if the button should be disabled.  
(Disabled buttons are dimmed and will not respond to user input 
or fire events.  Does not apply to button's of type "link.")

href.description:
String specifying the href for the button.  Applies only to 
buttons of type "link."

onclick.description:
Object literal representing the code to be executed when the button is clicked. Format:
{
fn: Function, // The handler to call when the event fires.
obj: Object, // An object to pass back to the handler.
scope: Object // The object to use for the scope of the handler.
}

target.description:
String specifying the target for the button.  Applies only  
to buttons of type "link."

container.description:
HTML element reference or string specifying the id 
attribute of the HTML element that the button's markup should be 
rendered into.

selectedMenuItem.description:
Reference to the item in the button's menu that is
currently selected.

type.description:
String specifying the button's type.  Possible values are: 
"button," "link," "submit," "reset," "checkbox," "radio," "menubutton," 
and "splitbutton."

tabindex.description: Number specifying the tabindex for the button.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: String specifying the id attribute of the <input>, <a> or <span> element to be used to create the button.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description: Object reference for the <input>, <a> or <span> element to be used to create the button.

params.name: p_oElement
params.description:
Object literal specifying a set of configuration  
attributes used to create the button.

params.name: p_oAttributes
params.description:
Optional. Object literal specifying a set of 
configuration attributes used to create the button.

constructors.description: The Button class creates a rich, graphical button.

focus.description: Fires when the menu item receives focus. Passes back a single object representing the original DOM event object passed back by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event) when the event was fired. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

option.description: Fires when the user invokes the button's option. Passes back a single object representing the original DOM event (either "mousedown" or "keydown") that caused the "option" event to fire. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

blur.description: Fires when the menu item loses the input focus. Passes back a single object representing the original DOM event object passed back by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event) when the event was fired. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

params.name: p_oEvent
params.description:
Object representing the DOM event object passed 
back by the event utility (YAHOO.util.Event) that triggered the display of
the menu.

hasOwnProperty.description:
Determines whether or not the property was added to the object instance. Returns false if the property is not present in the object, or was inherited from the prototype. This abstraction is provided to enable hasOwnProperty for Safari 1.3.x. There is a discrepancy between YAHOO.lang.hasOwnProperty and Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty when the property is a primitive added to both the instance AND prototype with the same value: 
var A = function() {};
A.prototype.foo = 'foo';
var a = new A();
a.foo = 'foo';
alert(a.hasOwnProperty('foo')); // true
alert(YAHOO.lang.hasOwnProperty(a, 'foo')); // false when using fallback

in the supplier will be used unless it would

augment.description:
Applies all prototype properties in the supplier to the receiver if the
receiver does not have these properties yet.  Optionally, one or more
methods/properties can be specified (as additional parameters).  This
option will overwrite the property if receiver has it already.

YAHOO.widget.Menubar.name: YAHOO.widget.Menubar

position.description:
String indicating how a menu bar should be positioned on the 
screen.  Possible values are "static" and "dynamic."  Static menu bars 
are visible by default and reside in the normal flow of the document 
(CSS position: static).  Dynamic menu bars are hidden by default, reside
out of the normal flow of the document (CSS position: absolute), and can 
overlay other elements on the screen.

submenualignment.description:
Array defining how submenus should be aligned to their 
parent menu bar item. The format is: [itemCorner, submenuCorner].

autosubmenudisplay.description:
Boolean indicating if submenus are automatically made 
visible when the user mouses over the menu bar's items.

YAHOO.widget.Calendar.name: YAHOO.widget.Calendar

SHOW_WEEKDAYS.description: True if the Calendar should show weekday labels. True by default.

MDY_DAY_POSITION.description: The position of the day in a month/day/year date string

MY_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/year date string

MONTHS_SHORT.description: The short month labels for the current locale.

MULTI_SELECT.description: True if the Calendar should allow multiple selections. False by default.

DATE_FIELD_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit date fields in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

MY_YEAR_POSITION.description: The position of the year in a month/year date string

close.description: Whether or not a close button should be displayed for this Calendar

MONTHS_LONG.description: The long month labels for the current locale.

WEEKDAYS_MEDIUM.description: The medium weekday labels for the current locale.

DATE_RANGE_DELIMITER.description: The value used to delimit date ranges in a date string passed to various Calendar functions.

SHOW_WEEK_HEADER.description: True if the Calendar should show week row headers. False by default.

title.description: The title to display above the Calendar's month header

maxdate.description: The maximum selectable date in the current Calendar (mm/dd/yyyy)

selected.description: The date or range of dates representing the current Calendar selection

LOCALE_WEEKDAYS.description: The setting that determines which length of weekday labels should be used. Possible values are "1char", "short", "medium", and "long".

NAV_ARROW_RIGHT.description: The image that should be used for the right navigation arrow.
NAV_ARROW_RIGHT.deprecated: You can customize the image by overriding the default CSS class for the right arrow - "calnavright"

HIDE_BLANK_WEEKS.description: True if the Calendar should suppress weeks that are not a part of the current month. False by default.

mindate.description: The minimum selectable date in the current Calendar (mm/dd/yyyy)

START_WEEKDAY.description: The weekday the week begins on. Default is 0 (Sunday).

SHOW_WEEK_FOOTER.description: True if the Calendar should show week row footers. False by default.

MDY_YEAR_POSITION.description: The position of the year in a month/day/year date string

WEEKDAYS_LONG.description: The long weekday labels for the current locale.

MDY_MONTH_POSITION.description: The position of the month in a month/day/year date string

pagedate.description: The month/year representing the current visible Calendar date (mm/yyyy)

MD_DAY_POSITION.description: The position of the day in a month/year date string

NAV_ARROW_LEFT.description: The image that should be used for the left navigation arrow.

constructors.description:
Calendar is the base class for the Calendar widget. In its most basic implementation, it has the ability to render a calendar widget on the page that can be manipulated to select a single date, move back and forth between months and years.

To construct the placeholder for the calendar widget, the code is as follows:

<div id="cal1Container"></div> Note that the table can be replaced with any kind of element.

<div id="cal1Container"></div> Note that the table can be replaced with any kind of element.

YAHOO.util.History.name: YAHOO.util.History

constructors.description:
The History class provides the ability to use the back/forward navigation
buttons in a DHTML application. It also allows a DHTML application to
be bookmarked in a specific state.

onLoadEvent.description: Fired when the Browser History Manager is ready.

return.description: The bookmarked state of the specified module.

getBookmarkedState.description:
Returns the state of a module according to the URL fragment
identifier. This method is useful to initialize your modules
if your application was bookmarked from a particular state.

params.name: module
params.description: Non-empty string representing your module.

return.description: The current state of the specified module.

getCurrentState.description: Returns the current state of the specified module.

params.name: module
params.description: Non-empty string representing your module.

params.name: fqstate
params.description: Fully qualified state

_handleFQStateChange.description:
Sets the new currentState attribute of all modules depending on the new
fully qualified state. Also notifies the modules which current state has
changed.

return.description: Indicates whether the new state was successfully added to the history.

navigate.description: Call this method when you want to store a new entry in the browser's history.

params.name: module
params.description: Non-empty string representing your module.

params.name: state
params.description: String representing the new state of the specified module.

_initialize.description: Finish up the initialization of the Browser History Manager.

params.name: module
params.description:
Non-empty string uniquely identifying the
module you wish to register.

params.name: initialState
params.description:
The initial state of the specified
module corresponding to its earliest history entry.

params.name: onStateChange
params.description:
Callback called when the
state of the specified module has changed.

params.name: obj
params.description:
An arbitrary object that will be passed as a
parameter to the handler.

params.name: override
params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes the
execution scope of the listener.

_checkIframeLoaded.description: Periodically checks whether our internal IFrame is ready to be used.

params.name: iframeTarget
params.description:
Optional - Path to an existing
HTML document accessible from the same domain. If not
specified, defaults to "blank.html". This is only useful
if you use https.

initialize.description:
Initializes the Browser History Manager. Call this method
from a script block located right after the opening body tag.

_storeStates.description:
Stores all the registered modules' initial state and current state.
On Safari, we also store all the fully qualified states visited by
the application within a single browser session. The storage takes
place in the form field specified during initialization.

return.description: The value of the specified parameter, or null.

getQueryStringParameter.description:
Returns the value of the specified query string parameter.
This method is not used internally by the Browser History Manager.
However, it is provided here as a helper since many applications
using the Browser History Manager will want to read the value of
url parameters to initialize themselves.

params.name: paramName
params.description: Name of the parameter we want to look up.

params.name: queryString
params.description:
Optional URL to look at. If not specified,
this method uses the URL in the address bar.

return.description: The hash portion of the document's location

_getHash.description:
location.hash is a bit buggy on Opera. I have seen instances where
navigating the history using the back/forward buttons, and hence
changing the URL, would not change location.hash. That's ok, the
implementation of an equivalent is trivial.

return.description: The trimmed string

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be trimmed.

_storageField.description:
INPUT field (with type="hidden" or type="text") or TEXTAREA.
This field keeps the value of the initial state, current state
the list of all states across pages within a single browser session.

_storageFieldReady.description: Flag used to tell whether the storage field is ready to be used.

_initialized.description: Flag used to tell whether YAHOO.util.History.initialize has been called.

_bhmReady.description: Flag used to tell whether the Browser History Manager is ready.

_iframe.description: Our hidden IFrame used to store the browsing history.

_browser.description:
String identifying which browser we are in.
Different code is run depending on which browser you are using.

_ua.description: User agent string used for browser detection.

_fqstates.description: List of fully qualified states. This is used only by Safari.

YAHOO.util.History.description:
The History class provides the ability to use the back/forward navigation
buttons in a DHTML application. It also allows a DHTML application to
be bookmarked in a specific state.

constructors.description: Dialog is an implementation of Panel that can be used to submit form data. Built-in functionality for buttons with event handlers is included, and button sets can be build dynamically, or the preincluded ones for Submit/Cancel and OK/Cancel can be utilized. Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, or manually.

tabs.description: The Tabs belonging to the TabView instance.

orientation.description: How the Tabs should be oriented relative to the TabView.

The html 
element that represents the TabView, or the attribute object to use. 
An element will be created if none provided.

params.description:
(optional) A key map of the tabView's 
initial attributes.  Ignored if first arg is attributes object.

constructors.description: A widget to control tabbed views.

beforeActiveTabChange.description:
Fires before the activeTab is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeActiveTabChange
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> prevValue the currently active tab
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> newValue the tab to be made active

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeActiveTabChange', handler);

orientationChange.description:
Fires after the orientation is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type orientationChange
<String> prevValue the former orientation
<String> newValue the new orientation

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('orientationChange', handler);

activeTabChange.description:
Fires after the activeTab is changed.

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type activeTabChange
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> prevValue the formerly active tab
<YAHOO.widget.Tab> newValue the new active tab

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('activeTabChange', handler);

beforeOrientationChange.description:
Fires before the orientation is changed.

See: Element.addListener

If handler returns false, the change will be cancelled, and the value will not be set.

Event fields:
<String> type beforeOrientationChange
<String> prevValue the current orientation
<String> newValue the new orientation to be applied

Usage:
var handler = function(e) {var previous = e.prevValue};
myTabs.addListener('beforeOrientationChange', handler);

YAHOO.widget.Module.description: Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI Container package.

var handler = function(e) {var target = e.target};

See: Element.addListener

Event fields:
<String> type contentReady
<HTMLElement> target the HTMLElement bound to this Element instance

var handler = function(e) {var target = e.target};
myTabs.addListener('contentReady', handler);

YAHOO.util.ColorAnim.name: YAHOO.util.ColorAnim

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for color transitions.

Usage: var myAnim = new Y.ColorAnim(el, { backgroundColor: { from: '#FF0000', to: '#FFFFFF' } }, 1, Y.Easing.easeOut); Color values can be specified with either 112233, #112233, [255,255,255], or rgb(255,255,255)

return.description: The 3-tuple of rgb values.

params.name: s
params.description: The string to parse.

parseColor.description: Attempts to parse the given string and return a 3-tuple.

YAHOO.util.ColorAnim.description:
Anim subclass for color transitions.

Usage: var myAnim = new Y.ColorAnim(el, { backgroundColor: { from: '#FF0000', to: '#FFFFFF' } }, 1, Y.Easing.easeOut); Color values can be specified with either 112233, #112233, [255,255,255], or rgb(255,255,255)

YAHOO_config.name: YAHOO_config

listener.description: A reference to a function that will be executed every time a YAHOO module is loaded. As parameter, this function will receive the version information for the module. See YAHOO.env.getVersion for the description of the version data structure.

YAHOO_config.description:
YAHOO_config is not included part of the library.  Instead it is an object
that can be defined by the implementer immediately before including the
YUI library.  The properties included in this object will be used to
configure global properties needed as soon as the library begins to load.

When a LogReader console reaches its thresholdMax, it will clear out messages
and print out the latest thresholdMin number of messages.

A class member shared by all LogReaders if a container needs to be
created during instantiation. Will be null if a container element never needs to
be created on the fly, such as when the implementer passes in their own element.

params.description: An object to be passed along when the event fires

params.description:
If true, the obj passed in becomes the execution
scope of the listener

constructors.description: Stores the subscriber information to be used when the event fires.

params.name: defaultScope
params.description:
the scope to use if this listener does not
override it.

getScope.description:
Returns the execution scope for this listener.  If override was set to true
the custom obj will be the scope.  If override is an object, that is the
scope, otherwise the default scope will be used.

return.description:
true if the supplied arguments match this 
subscriber's signature.

params.name: fn
params.description: the function to execute

params.name: obj
params.description: an object to be passed along when the event fires

contains.description:
Returns true if the fn and obj match this objects properties.
Used by the unsubscribe method to match the right subscriber.

override.description:
The default execution scope for the event listener is defined when the
event is created (usually the object which contains the event).
By setting override to true, the execution scope becomes the custom
object passed in by the subscriber.  If override is an object, that 
object becomes the scope.

obj.description:
An optional custom object that will passed to the callback when
the event fires

fn.description: The callback that will be execute when the event fires

YAHOO.util.Subscriber.description: Stores the subscriber information to be used when the event fires.

YAHOO.env.name: YAHOO.env

return.description: The version info

getVersion.description:
Returns the version data for the specified module:
<dl>
<dt>name:</dt>      <dd>The name of the module</dd>
<dt>version:</dt>   <dd>The version in use</dd>
<dt>build:</dt>     <dd>The build number in use</dd>
<dt>versions:</dt>  <dd>All versions that were registered</dd>
<dt>builds:</dt>    <dd>All builds that were registered.</dd>
<dt>mainClass:</dt> <dd>An object that was was stamped with the
current version and build. If 
mainClass.VERSION != version or mainClass.BUILD != build,
multiple versions of pieces of the library have been
loaded, potentially causing issues.</dd>
</dl>

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the module (event, slider, etc)

listeners.description:
List of functions that should be executed every time a YUI module
reports itself.

modules.description: Keeps the version info for all YUI modules that have reported themselves

YAHOO.env.description:
YAHOO.env is used to keep track of what is known about the YUI library and
the browsing environment

params.description: Source of LogWriter, or null if global.

log.description:
Saves a log message to the stack and fires newLogEvent. If the log message is
assigned to an unknown category, creates a new category. If the log message is
from an unknown source, creates a new source.  If browser console is enabled,
outputs the log message to browser console.

params.name: sMsg
params.description: The error message.

params.name: sUrl
params.description: URL of the error.

params.name: sLine
params.description: Line number of the error.

_onWindowError.description: Handles logging of messages due to window error events.

return.description: Returns true if category is unknown, else returns false.

_isNewCategory.description: Checks to see if a category has already been created.

params.name: sCategory
params.description: Category name.

params.name: sCategory
params.description: Category name.

_createNewCategory.description: Creates a new category of log messages and fires categoryCreateEvent.

params.name: oEntry
params.description: Log entry object.

_printToBrowserConsole.description: Outputs a log message to global console.log() function.

params.name: sSource
params.description: Source name.

_createNewSource.description: Creates a new source of log messages and fires sourceCreateEvent.

enableBrowserConsole.description:
Enables output to the browser's global console.log() function, which is used
by the Firebug extension to Firefox as well as Safari.

disableBrowserConsole.description:
Disables output to the browser's global console.log() function, which is used
by the Firebug extension to Firefox as well as Safari.

return.description: Internal date of when Logger singleton was initialized.

getStartTime.description: Public accessor to internal start time.

maxStackEntries.description: Upper limit on size of internal stack.

_browserConsoleEnabled.description: Internal property to track whether output to browser console is enabled.

loggerEnabled.description: True if Logger is enabled, false otherwise.

_stack.description: Array to hold all log messages.

YAHOO.widget.Logger.description:
The singleton Logger class provides core log management functionality. Saves
logs written through the global YAHOO.log function or written by a LogWriter
instance. Provides access to logs for reading by a LogReader instance or
native browser console such as the Firebug extension to Firefox or Safari's
JavaScript console through integration with the console.log() method.

YAHOO.util.Anim.name: YAHOO.util.Anim

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Base animation class that provides the interface for building animated effects.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Anim(el, { width: { from: 10, to: 100 } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

onComplete.description:
Custom event that fires when animation ends
Listen via subscribe method (e.g. myAnim.onComplete.subscribe(someFunction)

onStart.description:
Custom event that fires when animation begins
Listen via subscribe method (e.g. myAnim.onStart.subscribe(someFunction)

onTween.description:
Custom event that fires between each frame
Listen via subscribe method (e.g. myAnim.onTween.subscribe(someFunction)

return.description: current value of isAnimated.

isAnimated.description: Checks whether the element is currently animated.

return.description: val The current value of the attribute.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

getAttribute.description: Returns current value of the attribute.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

params.name: val
params.description: The value to be applied to the attribute.

params.name: unit
params.description: The unit ('px', '%', etc.) of the value.

setAttribute.description: Applies a value to an attribute.

onTween.description: Feeds the starting and ending values for each animated attribute to doMethod once per frame, then applies the resulting value to the attribute(s).

return.description: The Value to be applied to the attribute.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

params.name: start
params.description: The value this attribute should start from for this animation.

params.name: end
params.description: The value this attribute should end at for this animation.

doMethod.description: Returns the value computed by the animation's "method".

getEl.description: Returns a reference to the animated element.

params.name: attr
params.description: The attribute object

setRuntimeAttribute.description: Sets the actual values to be used during the animation.  Should only be needed for subclass use.

params.name: finish
params.description: (optional) If true, animation will jump to final frame.

stop.description: Stops the animation.  Normally called by AnimMgr when animation completes.

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

init.description: Constructor for Anim instance.

toString.description: Provides a readable name for the Anim instance.

return.description: The default unit to be used.

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute.

getDefaultUnit.description: Returns the unit to use when none is supplied.

animate.description: Starts the animation by registering it with the animation manager.

return.description: current value of startTime.

isAnimated.description: Whether or not the animation is running.

_onTween.description: Custom event that fires after onTween

actualFrames.description: The number of frames this animation was able to execute.

useSeconds.description:
Whether or not the duration should be treated as seconds.
Defaults to true.

totalFrames.description:
The total number of frames to be executed.
In time-based animations, this is used by AnimMgr to ensure the animation finishes on time.

_onStart.description: Custom event that fires after onStart, useful in subclassing

_onComplete.description: Custom event that fires after onComplete

startTime.description: A Date object that is created when the animation begins.

duration.description: The length of the animation.  Defaults to "1" (second).

attributes.description:
The collection of attributes to be animated.  
Each attribute must have at least a "to" or "by" defined in order to animate.  
If "to" is supplied, the animation will end with the attribute at that value.  
If "by" is supplied, the animation will end at that value plus its starting value. 
If both are supplied, "to" is used, and "by" is ignored. 
Optional additional member include "from" (the value the attribute should start animating from, defaults to current value), and "unit" (the units to apply to the values).

method.description:
The method that will provide values to the attribute(s) during the animation. 
Defaults to "YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone".

currentFrame.description:
The location of the current animation on the timeline.
In time-based animations, this is used by AnimMgr to ensure the animation finishes on time.

YAHOO.util.Anim.description:
Base animation class that provides the interface for building animated effects.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Anim(el, { width: { from: 10, to: 100 } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.DDProxy.name: YAHOO.util.DDProxy

params.name: id
params.description: the id of the linked html element

params.name: sGroup
params.description: the group of related DragDrop objects

params.name: config
params.description:
an object containing configurable attributes
Valid properties for DDProxy in addition to those in DragDrop: 
resizeFrame, centerFrame, dragElId

constructors.description:
A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into
the document that follows the cursor during drag operations.  At the time of
the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html
element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.
References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that
was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the
page.

createFrame.description: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

initFrame.description:
Initialization for the drag frame element.  Must be called in the
constructor of all subclasses

_resizeProxy.description:
The proxy is automatically resized to the dimensions of the linked
element when a drag is initiated, unless resizeFrame is set to false

params.name: iPageX
params.description: X click position

params.name: iPageY
params.description: Y click position

showFrame.description:
Resizes the drag frame to the dimensions of the clicked object, positions 
it over the object, and finally displays it

YAHOO.util.DDProxy.dragElId.description: The default drag frame div id

resizeFrame.description:
By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element
we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect).  We can turn it off
if we want a different behavior.

centerFrame.description:
By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so
we use the cursor offset provided by YAHOO.util.DD.  Another option that works only if
you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered
around the cursor.  Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

YAHOO.util.DDProxy.description:
A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into
the document that follows the cursor during drag operations.  At the time of
the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html
element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.
References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that
was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the
page.

iframe.default: true for IE6 and below, false for all others
iframe.description: True if the Overlay should have an IFRAME shim (for correcting the select z-index bug in IE6 and below).

constraintoviewport.description: True if the Overlay should be prevented from being positioned out of the viewport.

xy.description: An array with the absolute x and y positions of the Overlay

context.description: The array of context arguments for context-sensitive positioning. The format is: [id or element, element corner, context corner]. For example, setting this property to ["img1", "tl", "bl"] would align the Overlay's top left corner to the context element's bottom left corner.

y.description: The absolute y-coordinate position of the Overlay

x.description: The absolute x-coordinate position of the Overlay

fixedcenter.description: True if the Overlay should be anchored to the center of the viewport.

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing 10/23/2006the configuration that should be set for this Overlay. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Overlay is a Module that is absolutely positioned above the page flow. It has convenience methods for positioning and sizing, as well as options for controlling zIndex and constraining the Overlay's position to the current visible viewport. Overlay also contains a dynamicly generated IFRAME which is placed beneath it for Internet Explorer 6 and 5.x so that it will be properly rendered above SELECT elements.

DataSource.name: DataSource

params.name: oLiveData
params.description: Pointer to live database

params.name: oConfigs
params.description: (optional) Object literal of configuration values

constructors.description:
The DataSource class defines and manages a live set of data for widgets to
interact with. Examples of live databases include in-memory
local data such as a JavaScript array, a JavaScript function, or JSON, or
remote data such as data retrieved through an XHR connection.

_nIndex.description: Internal class variable to index multiple DataSource instances.

maxCacheEntries.description:
Max size of the local cache.  Set to 0 to turn off caching.  Caching is
useful to reduce the number of server connections.  Recommended only for data
sources that return comprehensive results for queries or when stale data is
not an issue.

TYPE_XHR.description: Type is hosted on a server via an XHR connection.

dataType.description: Where the live data is held.

connMgr.description:
Alias to YUI Connection Manager. Allows implementers to specify their own
subclasses of the YUI Connection Manager utility.

ERROR_DATANULL.description: Error message for null data responses.

_aCache.description: Local cache of data result objects indexed chronologically.

connTimeout.description:
If data is accessed over XHR via Connection Manager, the connection timeout is
configurable in milliseconds the XHR connection will wait for a server
response. A a value of zero indicates the XHR connection will wait forever.
Any value greater than zero will use the Connection utility's Auto-Abort
feature.

ERROR_DATAINVALID.description: Error message for invalid data responses.

responseSchema.description:
Response schema object literal takes a combination of the following properties:
<dl>
<dt>resultsList</dt> <dd>Pointer to array of tabular data</dd>
<dt>resultNode</dt> <dd>Pointer to node name of row data (XML data only)</dd>
<dt>recordDelim</dt> <dd>Record delimiter (text data only)</dd>
<dt>fieldDelim</dt> <dd>Field delimiter (text data only)</dd>
<dt>fields</dt> <dd>Array of field names (aka keys), or array of object literals
such as: {key:"fieldname",converter:YAHOO.util.DataSource.convertDate}</dd>
</dl>

DataSource.description:
The DataSource class defines and manages a live set of data for widgets to
interact with. Examples of live databases include in-memory
local data such as a JavaScript array, a JavaScript function, or JSON, or
remote data such as data retrieved through an XHR connection.

be used to render this node

params.name: oParent

constructors.description:
The default node presentation.  The first parameter should be
either a string that will be used as the node's label, or an object
that has a string propery called label.  By default, the clicking the
label will toggle the expanded/collapsed state of the node.  By
changing the href property of the instance, this behavior can be
changed so that the label will go to the specified href.

return.description: the element
false to cancel the anchor click

The CSS class for the label href.  Defaults to ygtvlabel, but can be
overridden to provide a custom presentation for a specific node.

label.description:
The text for the label.  It is assumed that the oData parameter will
either be a string that will be used as the label, or an object that
has a property called "label" that we will use.

constructors.description:
A point is a region that is special in that it represents a single point on 
the grid.

YAHOO.util.Motion.name: YAHOO.util.Motion

params.name: el
params.description: Reference to the element that will be animated

params.name: attributes
params.description:
The attribute(s) to be animated.  
Each attribute is an object with at minimum a "to" or "by" member defined.  
Additional optional members are "from" (defaults to current value), "units" (defaults to "px").  
All attribute names use camelCase.

params.name: duration
params.description: (optional, defaults to 1 second) Length of animation (frames or seconds), defaults to time-based

params.name: method
params.description: (optional, defaults to YAHOO.util.Easing.easeNone) Computes the values that are applied to the attributes per frame (generally a YAHOO.util.Easing method)

constructors.description:
Anim subclass for moving elements along a path defined by the "points" member of "attributes". All "points" are arrays with x, y coordinates.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Motion(el, { points: { to: [800, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.util.Motion.description:
Anim subclass for moving elements along a path defined by the "points" member of "attributes". All "points" are arrays with x, y coordinates.

Usage: var myAnim = new YAHOO.util.Motion(el, { points: { to: [800, 800] } }, 1, YAHOO.util.Easing.easeOut);

YAHOO.widget.Tooltip.name: YAHOO.widget.Tooltip

container.description: Specifies the container element that the Tooltip's markup should be rendered into.

showdelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before showing a Tooltip on mouseover.

preventoverlap.description: Specifies whether the Tooltip should be kept from overlapping its context element.

context.description: Specifies the element or elements that the Tooltip should be anchored to on mouseover.

autodismissdelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before automatically dismissing a Tooltip after the mouse has been resting on the context element.

hidedelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before hiding a Tooltip on mouseover.

a string or object containing the data that will
be used to render this node

constructors.description:
The base class for all tree nodes.  The node's presentation and behavior in
response to mouse events is handled in Node subclasses.

parentChange.description:
The parentChange event is fired when a parent element is applied
to the node.  This is useful if you need to apply tree-level
properties to a tree that need to happen if a node is moved from
one tree to another.

return.description: the child node

appendChild.description: Appends a node to the child collection.

params.description: the new node

params.name: fmDataLoader
params.description: the function that will be used to get the data.

params.name: iconMode
params.description:
configures the icon that is displayed when a dynamic
load node is expanded the first time without children.  By default, the 
"collapse" icon will be used.  If set to 1, the leaf node icon will be
displayed.

setDynamicLoad.description:
Configures this node for dynamically obtaining the child data
when the node is first expanded.  Calling it without the callback
will turn off dynamic load for the node.

return.description: this node's children div

getChildrenEl.description: Returns the div that was generated for this node's children

toggle.description: Expands if node is collapsed, collapses otherwise.

collapse\ntoggle style..description: Hides this nodes children (creating them if necessary), changes the

getHtml.description: Returns the markup for this node and its children.

return.description: the inserted node

params.description: the node to insert this node before

insertBefore.description: Inserts this node before this supplied node

return.description:
true if this has children or if it might and we are
checking for this condition.

params.name: checkForLazyLoad
params.description: should we check for unloaded children?

hasChildren.description:
Checks if this node has children.  If this node is lazy-loading and the
children have not been rendered, we do not know whether or not there
are actual children.  In most cases, we need to assume that there are
children (for instance, the toggle needs to show the expandable 
presentation state).  In other times we want to know if there are rendered
children.  For the latter, "checkForLazyLoad" should be false.

return.description: true if this node's children are to be loaded dynamically

isDynamic.description:
Evaluates if this node's children should be loaded dynamically.  Looks for
the property both in this instance and the root node.  If the tree is
defined to load all children dynamically, the data callback function is
defined in the root node

Returns the css class for the spacer at the specified depth for

has a next sibling the presentation is different than if it
does not have a next sibling

expandAll.description: Recursively expands all of this node's children.

getToggleLink.description: Generates the link that will invoke this node's toggle method

getSiblings.description: Returns a node array of this node's siblings, null if none.

getStyle.description: Returns the css style name for the toggle

Get the markup for the node.  This is designed to be overrided so that we can
support different types of nodes.

return.description: 0 for collapse style, 1 for leaf node style

getIconMode.description:
Returns the current icon mode.  This refers to the way childless dynamic
load nodes appear.

params.name: depth
params.description: the depth of the ancestor.

getAncestor.description: Returns this node's ancestor at the specified depth.

loadComplete.description:
Load complete is the callback function we pass to the data provider
in dynamic load situations.

expand.description:
Shows this nodes children (creating them if necessary), changes the
toggle style, and collapses its siblings if multiExpand is not set.

return.description: the element id

getElId.description: Returns the id for this node's container div

return.description: true if this is the root node

isRoot.description: Evaluates if this node is the root node of the tree

completeRender.description: Called when we know we have all the child data.

The node index if this Node is a child of 
supplied Node, else -1.

params.name: parentNode
params.description: the Node to check

return.description: the children container div html and any expanded children

getChildrenHtml.description:
Called when first rendering the tree.  We always build the div that will
contain this nodes children, but we don't render the children themselves
unless this node is expanded.

refresh.description:
Regenerates the html for this node and its children.  To be used when the
node is expanded and new children have been added.

return.description: the toggel element id

getToggleElId.description: Returns the id for this node's toggle element

return.description: the html for this node's children

renderChildren.description:
Generates the markup for the child nodes.  This is not done until the node
is expanded.

return.description: the css class hover state

getHoverStyle.description: Returns the hover style for the icon

collapseAll.description: Recursively collapses all of this node's children.

return.description: true if the application was successful

params.name: parentNode
params.description: this node's parent node

applyParent.description:
Certain properties for the node cannot be set until the parent
is known. This is called after the node is inserted into a tree.
the parent is also applied to this node's children in order to
make it possible to move a branch from one tree to another.

childrenRendered.description:
This flag is set to true when the html is generated for this node's
children, and set to false when new children are added.

renderHidden.description:
Should we render children for a collapsed node?  It is possible that the
implementer will want to render the hidden data...  @todo verify that we 
need this, and implement it if we do.

iconMode.description:
Used to configure what happens when a dynamic load node is expanded
and we discover that it does not have children.  By default, it is
treated as if it still could have children (plus/minus icon).  Set
iconMode to have it display like a leaf node instead.

href.description:
The href for the node's label.  If one is not specified, the href will
be set so that it toggles the node.

isLoading.description:
This is true for dynamically loading nodes while waiting for the
callback to return.

nowrap.description:
Specifies whether or not the content area of the node should be allowed
to wrap.

multiExpand.description: Can multiple children be expanded at once?

index.description: The index for this instance obtained from global counter in YAHOO.widget.TreeView.

_dynLoad.description:
We can set the node up to call an external method to get the child
data dynamically.

dataLoader.description: Function to execute when we need to get this node's child data.

data.description:
The data linked to this node.  This can be any object or primitive
value, and the data can be used in getNodeHtml().

dynamicLoadComplete.description:
Dynamically loaded nodes only fetch the data the first time they are
expanded.  This flag is set to true once the data has been fetched.

hasIcon.description:
The toggle/branch icon will not show if this is set to false.  This
could be useful if the implementer wants to have the child contain
extra info about the parent, rather than an actual node.

target.description: The label href target, defaults to current window

tree.description: Tree instance this node is part of

depth.description: The depth of this node.  We start at -1 for the root node.

YAHOO.widget.Node.description:
The base class for all tree nodes.  The node's presentation and behavior in
response to mouse events is handled in Node subclasses.

event.name: event
event.title: Event Utility
event.description:
The Event Utility provides utilities for managing DOM Events and tools
for building event systems

logger.name: logger
logger.title: Logger Widget
logger.description:
The Logger widget provides a simple way to read or write log messages in
JavaScript code. Integration with the YUI Library's debug builds allow
implementers to access under-the-hood events, errors, and debugging messages.
Output may be read through a LogReader console and/or output to a browser
console.

container.name: container
container.title: Container
container.description: The Container family of components is designed to enable developers to create different kinds of content-containing modules on the web. Module and Overlay are the most basic containers, and they can be used directly or extended to build custom containers. Also part of the Container family are four UI controls that extend Module and Overlay: Tooltip, Panel, Dialog, and SimpleDialog.

dom.name: dom
dom.description: The dom module provides helper methods for manipulating Dom elements.

menu.name: menu
menu.title: Menu
menu.description:
The Menu family of components features a collection of controls that make it easy to add menus to your website or web application. With the Menu Controls you can create website fly-out menus, customized context menus, or application-style menu bars with just a small amount of scripting.

The Menu family of controls features:

  • Screen-reader accessibility.
  • Keyboard and mouse navigation.
  • A rich event model that provides access to all of a menu's interesting moments.
  • Support for Progressive Enhancement; Menus can be created from simple, semantic markup on the page or purely through JavaScript.

button.name: button
button.title: Button
button.description:
The Button Control enables the creation of rich, graphical buttons that function like traditional HTML form buttons. Unlike tradition HTML form buttons, buttons created with the Button Control can have a label that is different from its value. With the inclusion of the optional Menu Control, the Button Control can also be used to create menu buttons and split buttons, controls that are not available natively in HTML. The Button Control can also be thought of as a way to create more visually engaging implementations of the browser's default radio-button and check-box controls.

The Button Control supports the following types:

button
Basic push button that can execute a user-specified command when pressed.
link
Navigates to a specified url when pressed.
submit
Submits the parent form when pressed.
reset
Resets the parent form when pressed.
checkbox
Maintains a "checked" state that can be toggled on and off.
radio
Maintains a "checked" state that can be toggled on and off. Use with the ButtonGroup class to create a set of controls that are mutually exclusive; checking one button in the set will uncheck all others in the group.
menubutton
When pressed will show/hide a menu.
splitbutton
Can execute a user-specified command or display a menu when pressed.

treeview.name: treeview
treeview.title: TreeView Widget
treeview.description: The treeview widget is a generic tree building tool.

yahoo.title: YAHOO Global
yahoo.name: yahoo
yahoo.description:
The YAHOO object is the single global object used by YUI Library.  It
contains utility function for setting up namespaces, inheritance, and
logging.  YAHOO.util, YAHOO.widget, and YAHOO.example are namespaces
created automatically for and used by the library.

element.name: element
element.description:
Element provides an wrapper object to simplify adding
event listeners, using dom methods, and managing attributes.

autocomplete.name: autocomplete
autocomplete.title: AutoComplete Widget
autocomplete.description:
The AutoComplete control provides the front-end logic for text-entry suggestion and
completion functionality.

slider.name: slider
slider.title: Slider Widget
slider.description:
The Slider component is a UI control that enables the user to adjust 
values in a finite range along one or two axes. Typically, the Slider 
control is used in a web application as a rich, visual replacement 
for an input box that takes a number as input. The Slider control can 
also easily accommodate a second dimension, providing x,y output for 
a selection point chosen from a rectangular region.

connection.name: connection
connection.description:
The Connection Manager provides a simplified interface to the XMLHttpRequest
object.  It handles cross-browser instantiantion of XMLHttpRequest, negotiates the
interactive states and server response, returning the results to a pre-defined
callback you create.

animation.name: animation
animation.description: The animation module provides allows effects to be added to HTMLElements.

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.title: DataSource Utility
datasource.description:
The DataSource utility provides a common configurable interface for widgets
to access a variety of data, from JavaScript arrays to online servers over
XHR.

tabview.name: tabview
tabview.description: The tabview module provides a widget for managing content bound to tabs.

calendar.name: calendar
calendar.title: Calendar
calendar.description: The Calendar component is a UI control that enables users to choose one or more dates from a graphical calendar presented in a one-month ("one-up") or two-month ("two-up") interface. Calendars are generated entirely via script and can be navigated without any page refreshes.

history.name: history
history.title: Browser History Manager
history.description:
The Browser History Manager provides the ability to use the
back/forward navigation buttons in a DHTML application. It also allows
a DHTML application to be bookmarked in a specific state.

datatable.name: datatable
datatable.title: DataTable Widget
datatable.description:
The DataTable widget provides a progressively enhanced DHTML control for
displaying tabular data across A-grade browsers.

dragdrop.name: dragdrop
dragdrop.title: Drag and Drop
dragdrop.description:
The drag and drop utility provides a framework for building drag and drop
applications.  In addition to enabling drag and drop for specific elements,
the drag and drop elements are tracked by the manager class, and the
interactions between the various elements are tracked during the drag and
the implementing code is notified about these important moments.
